Job Description:
Our Human Resources team is looking for an experienced Human Resources Legal Analyst to assist with developing and overseeing Employment related projects and functions for the organization. Supports business operations by analyzing project requirements, compliance ramifications, provide suggestions, and work with various departments to develop technology and procedures to ensure legal compliance, increase efficiencies, provide improved customer service and coworker experience, and meet Employment, HR’s and/or company strategic goals.

Responsibilities –

Conducts evaluation of existing employment and/or business processes for the purposes of identifying and executing on improvement initiatives, business growth, and strategic goals.
Collaborate with various divisions and cross-functional teams to gather insights, align employment strategies.
Ensure a cohesive and holistic approach between employment initiatives and strategic/operational goals of other divisions and/or company.
Collect and analyze data pertaining to effectiveness or strategic goals, seeking to identify trends, relationships and/or suggested improvements and courses of action.
Identifies and establishes scope, timeline, downstream impacts, and requirements analysis on a project-by-project basis to define project impact, outcome criteria, and metrics.
Monitor and track project progress and reduce/resolve any challenges that arise by making decisions, reporting out to management and other stakeholders, initiate strategy planning, and escalate as necessary.
Communicate changes, enhancements, and modifications of business requirements.
Prepare reports and presentations detailing compliance efforts, project status, and the impact of initiatives
Maintains, researches, and assesses employment policies and practices in alignment with best practices, industry trends, company strategic goals and compliance with federal, state (new and current states), and local laws and regulations.

Qualifications –

4-year Degree in Human Resources, Business, or related area
2+ years’ work experience in developing overarching policy, standards, processes, etc.; identifying trends; and overseeing larger scale projects
Knowledge of Federal, State, and other applicable laws (preferably employment), and their effect on decisions and actions in the workplace
Ability to collect, analyze, and interpret data from various sources
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Strong organizational skills and ability to manage multiple tasks at once
Ability to adapt to ever changing priorities
High degree of confidentiality
Excellent interpersonal communication skills

GENERAL: Business analysts are the drivers of our continued growth and success. Create and implement precise management plans for every project, with attention to transparent communication at all levels

Superior Fresh is an industry-leading aquaponics facility specializing in leafy greens and cold-water fish species. Our Northfield, WI facility is situated on an 800-acre Native Restoration Sanctuary nestled in the picturesque Coulee Region of Western Wisconsin. Our flagship aquaponics facility is the largest in the world, filled with the best equipment and technology. We raise premium Atlantic salmon and rainbow trout in a state-of-the-art land-based recirculation aquaculture facility in conjunction with premium, organic produce grown in an ultramodern hydroponics glass greenhouse. At Superior Fresh, we produce the freshest product available year-round, all while maintaining a water sustaining zero discharge to surface water facility.

The Data Analyst will play a pivotal role in our team, regularly employing advanced data analysis and machine learning strategies to surface information to inform business decisions. The Analyst will be expected to clearly interpret and communicate results, develop prototype simulations for training and predictive studies, and closely work with the IT department to develop system dashboard prototypes for multiple departments.

Primary Job Functions

· Build data structures to aid in the development of strategy and direction. Integrate, build, maintain, and refine data systems.

· Develop and update dashboards to monitor key metrics across all areas of the organization.

· Analyze data with the goal of delivering insights that improve revenue, cut waste or costs, or contribute to improved safety.

· Work with various teams to align data analytics and ensure accurate data representation.

· Design dashboards, presentations and summaries with clarity and structure that represents business needs.

· Utilize Microsoft tools and technology, integrating information from SCADA systems, Smartsheet and other tools as needed.

· Innovate and learn new technologies and methods, particularly related to machine vision tools.

· Demonstrate the Company’s Core and Growth Values in the performance of all job functions.

Secondary responsibilities that this job performs:

1. Maintain reliable attendance.

2. Actively participate in meetings, training and education.

3. Complete other assignments and special projects as requested.

Education:

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience and education, in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.

Proficiency in Microsoft tools and technology - Excel, Power BI, and SQL Server.

Competency in Power Query, SQL, Python, and/or R.

Knowledge of machine learning and vision tools preferred.

Experience:

2 years of experience in data analysis or a related field.

Experience in aquaponics, agriculture, food manufacturing or related industries is a plus but not required.

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities

· Demonstrated ability to learn new technologies and methods.

· Project management, including the ability to prioritize tasks, manage timelines, and work collaboratively with other team members.

· Microsoft Office proficiency.

· Excellent oral and written communication skills.

· Excellent interpersonal skills.

· Initiate and encourage the building of mutual trust, respect and cooperation among team members.

· Effective time management and organizational skills.

· Work independently as well as in a team environment.

· Maintain disciplined document management methods.

· Maintain confidentiality.

· Perform under strong demands in a fast-paced environment.

Job Title: Software Product Analyst/IT Business Analyst (Hybrid Work Model)
Job Description:
At Sentry, we’re more than just insurance—and we can offer you more than just a job. We want you to enjoy a career with us, where you’re in the driver’s seat of your career path with access to resources to help you succeed personally and professionally.

What You’ll Receive

You want a positive work/life balance. Our hybrid work model allows you to enjoy the benefits of working from home on Monday and Friday, but also provides the opportunity for team building and collaboration when working in the office on Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday. To help you work effectively and comfortably in both locations, we provide you with equipment to work at home and in the office.

You can enjoy a complete benefits package, including generous paid time off, 8% 401(k) match, matching charitable gift program, bonus plan based on company performance, meal stipends, associate discounts, and volunteer time off.

About Sentry

Our background: We’re one of the largest and most financially secure mutual insurance groups in the nation. More than 4,000 strong, our associates bring together diverse backgrounds, experiences, and skill sets to make Sentry who we are. We’re No. 658 on the Fortune 1000 list and named one of America’s Best Midsize Employers by Forbes. We’re in the business of helping others, and that includes the communities where we live and work. Our annual United Way campaign has raised more than $1 million for the past seven years.

Our Stevens Point campus offers a full-service fitness center, swimming pool, basketball and racquetball courts, auto center, credit union, on-site Aspirus clinic, restaurants, boutique hotel, and the award-winning SentryWorld golf course.

This position can be filled as a Software Product Analyst or Senior Software Product Analyst based on the qualifications and experience of the selected candidate.

What You’ll Do

You’re a valuable contributor. As an associate at Sentry, we believe in your skills and knowledge. Your input and participation matters. You’ll have the opportunity to:

Innovate: Through our scaled agile development process, you’ll have dedicated time to apply your creativity and innovation to drive new solutions.

Learn: Sentry provides several resources for furthering your career and continuing your personal development, including Sentry University, LinkedIn Learning, and developer-led educational sessions and communities.

Grow: Sentry provides many opportunities to grow in your career. Through meaningful, ongoing conversations around growth and development, we encourage all associates to take ownership in their career path.

Contribute: Our Software Product Analysts at Sentry are essential to our success of continuing to be innovative and competitive. As an Analyst you’ll:

Participate in discussions and interact with business users and customers to fully understand their business processes and work environment. Observe how they use software systems to do their job, and brainstorm ways to help them be more efficient and effective.

Learn to write crisp, concise requirements and user scenarios that clearly capture what the users want and help engineering bring them to life in software.

Learn to create comprehensive test cases to validate new system features. Work closely with engineering to ensure the system works and performs as intended. Work to anticipate users’ actions to find hidden system defects.

Gain a full understanding of how we develop software and provide ideas and perspective on how we could do it better. Develop a basic technical understanding. Be able to explain the technical building blocks and how information flows within our systems to users of the applications.

If you have experience or knowledge in one of the preferred skills listed above, we want you to consider joining the Sentry team!

How You’ll Apply

We’d love for you to join us. Please complete your online application and upload your resume on our Careers site. If you have applied with us before, you only need to provide your email address and password. If this is your first time applying with Sentry, please create an account.

If you have specific questions regarding the position, application process, or are interested in learning more about Sentry, please reach out to Katelynne Rivera, Talent Acquisition Specialist.

Get ready to own your future at Sentry. Your opportunity awaits.

Talent Acquisition Specialist

Introduction

It is the mission of the Wisconsin Department of Justice (DOJ) to protect the public and ensure that justice is done. To continue to meet this mission, the principles of equity, inclusion, and employee well-being have become a foundation for all work performed at DOJ, on behalf of Wisconsinites.
The DOJ is committed to developing and supporting a workforce and culture that is rich in diversity and innovation. It is the department’s goal to ensure that all DOJ employees are empowered to be authentic, claim belonging, and thrive. This is your opportunity to make and be the difference. Click here to learn more about DOJ.
In addition to working with a dynamic group of people, we offer amazing benefits , such as excellent health insurance, ample paid leave, flexible work schedules, and an employee assistance program that offers a variety of programs and resources to help promote wellness. Furthermore, employment within the state of Wisconsin provides job stability, work/life balance, and numerous intrinsic rewards from doing meaningful work.
Do you want to help make a difference in the lives of the public. The DOJ is currently looking for highly motivated and talented individuals to join our Division of Legal Services as a Data Analyst (Auditor-Senior) in the Medicaid Fraud Control and Elder Abuse Unit.
This position is headquartered at the Risser Justice Center located at 17 West Main Street in Madison.
The deadline to apply for this job announcement is Sunday, December 10, 2023, at 11:59pm. For any questions, please contact Pamela Fredrick, Human Resources Specialist at fredrickpj@doj.state.wi.us or (608) 419-3546 .
Position Summary

Under general supervision of the Deputy Unit Director, the Data Analyst position performs data processing functions coupled with sophisticated data analysis to identify anomalies indicative of fraud. The Data Analyst performs complex data extraction and analysis, at an advanced level, to assist in the investigation and prosecution of healthcare fraud committed against the Medicaid program, and the investigation of financial exploitation of vulnerable adults. The Data Analyst is primarily responsible for timely and accurately extracting, collecting, identifying, analyzing, and interpreting trends or patterns in complex Medicaid claims data, with the goal of identifying patterns or trends that suggest fraudulent activity, supporting, refuting or defining the allegations of fraud, highlighting useful information, suggesting conclusions, and supporting decision-making relative to criminal and civil fraud investigations. The Data Analyst also collects, identifies, analyzes and interprets financial, demographic, legal, social and other data sets, obtained from various sources.
Salary Information

The Auditor-Senior position is in pay schedule 07 and pay range 03. The starting pay will be between $32.00 - $37.00/hour (approx. $66,560 - $76,960 annually). Pay for current or former state employees will follow the provisions found in the State of Wisconsin Compensation Plan. A 12-month probationary period may be required.
Job Details

This position may be eligible to work remotely up to 60% as part of a hybrid schedule, following an initial training period. Travel to the headquarters is not eligible for travel reimbursement.
High speed internet access is required to meet the needs of remote work.
The Department of Justice does not sponsor work visas at the time of hire or anytime during employment. All persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and complete the required Employment Eligibility Form I-9.
A background check, including fingerprints, will be completed on applicants prior to selection.
Qualifications

Please address the following in your resume and/or letter of qualifications.
Minimally qualified applicants must have education, training and/or experience in the following : Proficiency using advanced Microsoft Excel, Access, or Power BI functions (such as pivot tables, macros, advanced sorts, etc). Working with financial or medical records and/or claims to check for accuracy and/or fraud. Drafting reports of findings. Managing multiple tasks and prioritizing competing deadlines.
In addition to the minimum qualifications, a well-qualified applicant will have education, training, and/or experience in the following: Working in a legal or law enforcement environment, which may include preparing materials for use in a trial setting or participating in court proceedings. Writing SQL or other queries to create reports from databases. Working with Medicaid rules or regulations or other healthcare fraud case types.
How To Apply

Apply online! To apply, click on “Apply for Job” to start the application process. Once logged in, click “Apply for Job” and follow the steps outlined in the application process. You will be required to submit a letter of qualifications and resume.
Each time you apply for a job; you should update and tailor your resume and letter of qualifications. You should clearly describe your education, training, and experience related to the items listed in the “Qualifications” section of the job announcement. These qualifications should be addressed in your resume and expanded upon in your letter of qualifications. This will allow a fuller assessment regarding your qualifications and those required for the job applying for.
Your resume should include the following: Your educational background including any course work that relates to the position in which you are applying. Your employment history, including experiences and/or duties and a summary of accomplishments and skills learned or used. Any training or experience, including volunteer work or internships, you have related specifically to the “Qualifications” section of the assessment. Spell out any acronyms and/or abbreviations the first time used.
Your letter of qualifications should include: Additional information regarding your past work experience, including volunteer work and internships, or coursework you have taken. Highlights of your most relevant skills and experiences as they related to the specific job you are applying for. Specific examples that clearly demonstrates your level of expertise.
What not to include in your resume or letter of qualifications:
Your application materials should not include any information that is not job-related, such as race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, creed, disability, or genetic information. Further, do not include any self-identifying information such as photos, social security numbers, political affiliation, citizen status or conviction records.
Application materials will be evaluated, and the most qualified applicants will be invited to participate in the next step of the process. References will be requested from top candidates once interviews have taken place.
NOTE: Current/former State employees interested in a permissive transfer, demotion or reinstatement consideration must also apply.
The State of Wisconsin is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer seeking a diverse and talented workforce. Veterans, women, people of color, LGBTQIA+, and people with disabilities are encouraged to apply. We provide reasonable accommodations to qualified applicants and employees with disabilities.
We appreciate the time and effort it takes to apply for positions. If any questions arise, please contact Pamela Fredrick, Human Resources Specialist, at fredrickpj@doj.state.wi.us or (608) 419-3546.
Deadline to Apply

The deadline to apply for this job announcement is Sunday, December 10, 2023 , at 11:59 PM.

Company Description


At Expert Institute, we’re building the smarter future of legal technology. Through our cloud-based expert service platform, Expert iQ, we empower attorneys with the expertise they need to win.

We’re proud to call some of the nation’s most prominent law firms as clients. Together with our network of over 3 million subject-matter experts, we’ve had a hand in securing over $20 billion in recovered value while working across recent civil rights, Big Tech, and major league sports-related litigation.

We’re making this all happen through a SaaS-enabled model: our team is the fuel helping the expert engine run. We’re a team of researchers, medical doctors, client advocates, business development leaders, and technologists. As we roll out new Expert iQ features, expand our client base, and onboard new experts, we’re always looking for growth-minded individuals to join the team.



Job Description


Our Content Data Analyst is focused on managing, reviewing, actively engaging in and approving various data projects to ensure Expert Institute's core data sets are normalized, accurate and of the highest quality. This position will be working in Data Central, our recently launched Content Collection and curation tool, which enables our products and legal clients to interact with experts within our network. The Content Data Analyst will report to the Product Manager, Data Central.

In this position, you will be responsible for:

Analyzing and curating multiple datasets of people involved in the legal process
Managing large datasets to ensure consistent normalization.
Analyzing content status and suggesting processes and automation that will best serve the data set quality and accuracy
Making sure the information meets Expert Institute’s standards in Data Central


Qualifications

2+ years of professional experience
Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Business Analytics, Data Science or other data related degrees is preferred.
Proficient in Excel and SQL queries
Experience and/or an affinity for managing, analyzing and curating multiple structured and unstructured data sets related to large entities and tangential data related to the legal and healthcare sectors
Mindset of continuous learning and improving
Close attention to detail, strong communication skills both written and verbal, ability to think quickly and critically
Comfortable working in a fast pace, dynamic environment
Ability to meet deadlines
No legal experience required

Additional Information


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Join an organization that strives to exceed customer expectations by delivering efficient, high-quality state government services. The Department of Administration (DOA) provides direct services to state agency customers and designs and leads initiatives to make government more innovative and cost-effective. Working at DOA offers you the opportunity to make an impact on the quality of life in Wisconsin.

Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging are core values at DOA that guide how we build our teams, develop our leaders, and create a culture that empowers everyone to be their authentic selves. We believe that when employees are respected and valued for who they are and are accountable for demonstrating that respect to others; it drives greater engagement and collaboration, ignites creativity and innovation, and fosters connection between teams and those we serve.

Position Summary



Under the general direction of the STAR (State Transforming Agency Resources) Program Office Procurement Section Chief, the Business Analyst serves as a business authority, resolving customer problems and is considered a functional system expert in regard to procurement and purchasing management. This position is responsible for ensuring data integrity and protecting sensitive information through advanced analysis/research and recommending solutions, policies and procedures; evaluating system functionality; design, testing, and documentation of the State’s ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) System within the Procurement Section.

The incumbent is an active member of the STAR Program Office. The STAR Program Office consists of Financial, Procurement, Human Resource, IT leads and change management staff. This position is accountable to demonstrate a commitment to customer service, organizational success and respect in the workplace. Incumbent provides customer service and expert system consultation to internal and external customers including state agencies, Courts, and Legislature. The incumbent participates in Statewide User Group meetings, which focus on utilizing the system efficiently and effectively. The incumbent serves as a liaison with the other STAR Support teams, State agencies, ensuring adherence to State and Federal policies, procedures, rules and regulations related to ERP systems. The incumbent is expected to be accountable for delivering measurably high-quality and responsive services and customer support.

For more information, please view the complete position description.

Job Details



Due to the nature of the position, DOA will conduct fingerprinting and/or background checks on applicants prior to selection. DOA does not sponsor work visas. This topic and any remote work flexibility that may be available will be discussed in more detail in the interview process.

Qualifications

Experience with business process design and documentation
Experience with Enterprise Resource Planning systems such as Peoplesoft, SAP, or similar.
Experience in procurement analysis and reporting

The Opportunity

We are seeking a talented Implementation Business Analyst I who will serve as a liaison among project stakeholders to understand business process, structure, policies, and operations of the organization with the goal of documenting requirements that will help deliver new and enhanced processes, products, and services. The Implementation Business Analyst is an external, client-facing role which assists in formulating recommendations that enable the organization or business unit to achieve its goals.

Day in the Life

Facilitates requirements for medium to large complexity projects to Implementation Engineer resources for build, and to Implementation QC resources for generating test cases.
Ensures requirements are testable and complete.
Provides evaluation of proposed solutions, defines configuration parameters used by Implementation Engineer resources in building the system, and further assess the deployed solution to ensure delivered results meet the needs or the business and/or client.
Helps define estimate, scope and requirements documentation and uses appropriate templates across all projects.
Utilizes methods of elicitation, requirements gathering, requirements analysis and solution assessment and validation. Understands stakeholder environment, prioritizing and refining requirements to meet the needs of the client and organization.
Assists in the evaluation of proposed solutions, ensures initial unit testing of all changes is completed, and further assess the deployed solution to ensure delivered results meet the needs of the business and or client.
Ensures the development of all project scope and requirement documents are completed and signed off on by internal business partners and clients. Uses an iterative approach, involving business and clients to ensure needs and requirements are well defined.
Communicates effectively, consistently, and iteratively with internal business partners and clients to ensure the understanding of appropriate business processes, requirements, and project timelines.
Follows change control and appropriate change management processes.
Develops working relationships with clients and internal business partners/ project team members to effectively communicate and support the successful delivery of Co-op Solutions implementations.

Experience

1-3 years of experience as a Business Analyst or in a Project Management role required.
Experience modeling/ mapping current to future state business processes required.
Experience performing current state analysis of existing business systems, applications and functions required.
Experience in test planning, test case development and execution preferred.
Experience with both traditional Waterfall SDLC and Agile/ Lean methodologies preferred.
Knowledge of SharePoint preferred.
Knowledge of finance, credit card systems and data sources is preferred.

For California, Colorado and New York Applicants: In accordance with the Equal Pay for Equal Work Act, the expected salary range for this position is between:

$53,000.00 - $66,500.00

Actual Pay will be adjusted based on experience and other job-related factors permitted by law.


This position qualifies for the following benefits; Co-op Solutions offers a competitive Total Rewards package: 401(k) with generous company match, Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance options, Health Savings Account/Flexible Spending Account, Life Insurance, Short- and Long-Term disability benefits, Pregnancy and Parental Leave, Tuition Reimbursement, Paid Time Off (PTO), Paid Holidays, Community Volunteer Time Off, and an Employee Assistance Program.

Company Name: Front Row Sales & Marketing on behalf of LeGrand
Job Description:
Hardware Data Analyst

On-Site - Eau Claire, WI

* Compensation for this Role averages $65,000 based on Education and Experience - Relocation Assistance and Employee Sponsorship are not available for this Role*

On behalf of our partner company, Legrand, we are currently seeking a Hardware Data Analyst for an on-site Role based out of Eau Claire, WI.

As a Hardware Data Analyst, you play a critical role in extracting, transforming, and analyzing data to provide actionable insights to our major Retail Partner. Additionally, the Hardware Data Analyst will manage various projects and serve as a key subject matter expert for projects and assignments.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Serve as the primary liaison for fellow Analysts employed by our Retail Partner and Vendor.
Conduct data-driven analysis and predictive modeling to determine optimal replenishment schedules, reorder points and inventory turnover strategies, collaborating with Retail and Vendor Teams to increase product margins, enhance inventory efficiency and reduce carrying costs.
Using our Retail Partners forecasting system, collect, cleanse, and analyze data focusing on forecasting sales trends and other relevant business metrics.
Collaborate with the Sales teams from both our Retailer Team and Vendor Partner Team to plan and forecast future sales events.
Generate regular and ad-hoc reports on a requested schedule, highlighting key performance indicators and tracking progress toward business goals.
Act as the point of contact for Retailers questions regarding ship dates, backorders, delivery issues, and pricing.
Cultivate and maintain productive relationships with key personnel from major Retailers and Vendors.
This role includes periodic travel for product training to enhance comprehension of products and sales and marketing strategies.
All other duties and projects as assigned by Vendor and Supervisor(s).

QUALIFICATIONS

High School Diploma/GED required. Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science, Business etx) and 3+ years in a similar role OR a pertinent combination of Education and experience.
Proven working knowledge of retail metrics and inventory analysis.
Proficiency in Microsoft Suite and data analysis tools.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong business acumen and the ability to translate data insights into actionable recommendations.
Use critical thinking to determine the best tools and techniques to address problems.

We are continually innovating and improving, challenging ourselves to take risks, learn from mistakes, and celebrate success as a team. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Basic job duties an employee must be able to perform with, or without, reasonable accommodation.
Critical Thinking — Using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems.
Reading Comprehension — Understanding written sentences and paragraphs in work related documents.
English Language — Knowledge of the structure and content of the English language including the meaning and spelling of words, rules of composition, and grammar.
Speaking — Talking to others to convey information effectively.
Active Learning — Understanding the implications of new information for both current and future problem-solving and decision-making.
Active Listening — Giving full attention to what other people is saying, taking time to understand the points being made, asking questions as appropriate, and not interrupting at inappropriate times.
Instructing — Teaching others how to do something.
Judgment and Decision Making — Considering the relative costs and benefits of potential actions to choose the most appropriate one.
Time Management — Managing one's own time and the time of others.
Writing — Communicating effectively in writing as appropriate for the needs of the audience.
Complex Problem Solving — Identifying complex problems and reviewing related information to develop and evaluate options and implement solutions.
Deductive Reasoning — The ability to apply general rules to specific problems to produce answers that make sense.
Problem Sensitivity — The ability to tell when something is wrong or is likely to go wrong. It does not involve solving the problem, only recognizing there is a problem.
Written Comprehension — The ability to read and understand information and ideas presented in writing.
Inductive Reasoning — The ability to combine pieces of information to form general rules or conclusions (includes finding a relationship among seemingly unrelated events).
Information Ordering — The ability to arrange things or actions in a certain order or pattern according to a specific rule or set of rules (e.g., patterns of numbers, letters, words, pictures, mathematical operations).
Near Vision — The ability to see details at close range (within a few feet of the observer).
Oral Comprehension — The ability to listen to and understand information and ideas presented through spoken words and sentences.
Oral Expression — The ability to communicate information and ideas in speaking so others will understand.
Speech Recognition — The ability to identify and understand the speech of another person.
Speech Clarity — The ability to speak clearly so others can understand you.

INTRODUCTION

This non-sworn (civilian) position is exempt from competitive examination and serves at the pleasure of the Chief of Police.

Located on the western shore of Lake Michigan, Milwaukee is an urban hub bursting with energy. Milwaukee provides a casual sophistication – big city appeal without the big city hassles. We are accessible and affordable, and our residents are welcoming. Milwaukee has evolved through the years, bringing together its unsurpassed charm with a breathtaking art museum, top-flight cultural attractions, professional sports, lakefront festivals, recreational opportunities, and great restaurants.

The City of Milwaukee is proud to employ a diverse workforce that is committed to providing exemplary service to the City’s residents. If you have a passion for being a part of an inclusive team of public servants, please consider the following opportunity.

PURPOSE

Under the direction of the Commanding Officer and/or the Crime and Intelligence Manager, the Crime Analyst collects, collates, analyzes, disseminates, and evaluates data to discover developing trends, patterns, and changes in criminal activity.

The Crime Analyst may be assigned to the Office of Management, Analysis and Planning (OMAP), the Fusion Division, or the Milwaukee Police Department (MPD) Districts.

**NOTE: Potential to promote to Crime Analyst II and then Crime Analyst III after successful job performance is demonstrated. **

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Research and Monitoring of Developing Crime Trends

Produce information related to crime trends to assist the department in preventing and suppressing criminal activities, to aid in the investigative process, to increase the apprehension of offenders, and to clear cases.
Utilize data to make recommendations regarding staff deployment and resource allocation.
Maintain, prepare, and present statistical and analytical reports detailing results of analyses, conclusions, and recommendations for command staff.

Data Analysis

Collect, analyze, and interpret data received from various departmental units and other law enforcement agencies.
Train departmental members on crime analysis techniques, including how to access and analyze various types of data.
Measure and forecast long-term public safety activity related to problem solving, intervention, and crime reduction efforts.

GIS Analysis

Maintain proficiency with geographic information systems (GIS) and crime analysis methods and tools.





We welcome qualified individuals with disabilities who are interested in employment and will make reasonable accommodations during the hiring process in accordance with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) of 1990, as amended by the Americans with Disabilities Act Amendments Act (ADAAA) of 2008.
CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT

Pass an MPD background investigation, medical examination, and pre-employment drug test.
Must work overtime and modified work schedules based on operational demand.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS

Bachelor’s degree in statistics, sociology, criminal justice, geography or a closely related field from an accredited college or university.
Valid driver’s license at time of appointment and throughout employment.

Note: Students with senior status may apply for this position but may not be appointed until their degree has been completed.

NOTICE: Please do not attach your academic transcripts to your employment application. The hiring department will verify candidates’ education as part of the background screening process prior to extending any job offers.

Equivalent combinations of education and experience may also be considered.

DESIRABLE QUALIFICATIONS

Master’s degree in statistics, sociology, criminal justice, geography, or a related field from an accredited college or university with a concentration in statistics, research methods, and intermediate or advanced quantitative or qualitative methods.
Knowledge of law enforcement computer systems, i.e., Records Management System (RMS) and Computer Aided Dispatch (CAD).

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES & OTHER CHARACTERISTICS

Technical

Knowledge of and ability to use sophisticated computer applications to conduct research, analyze data, and effectively present and communicate findings.
Knowledge of SPSS, SAS, or comparable programs; SQL (structured query language); Tableau; GIS; relational databases; and spreadsheet programs.
Ability to collect, analyze, and interpret data and statistics using quantitative and qualitative methods.
Ability to use both tactical and strategic crime analysis techniques when addressing crime problems.
Ability to prepare and present complex statistical reports.

Communication and Interpersonal

Ability to read, interpret, and explain complex technical information.
Written communication skills, including the ability to prepare clear reports.
Verbal communication skills, including the ability to present information effectively to various audiences.
Ability to work cooperatively, effectively, and fairly with people whose backgrounds may differ from one’s own.
Ability to collaborate and innovate with team members in a quasi-military environment under deadlines and in critical situations.

Judgment

Ability to use sound judgment using analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills.
Ability to plan and organize work related activities.
Ability to maintain confidentiality and exercise discretion in all work-related activities.
Ability to engage in continuous improvement activities to improve departmental programs and services.

The Business Intelligence Analyst supports end-to-end data management across the CapSpecialty ecosystem. In addition, the Business Analyst partners with various business and IT stakeholders to deliver new solutions as well as maintain the existing business intelligence solutions. This role will work to proactively identify issues and gaps in our data assets and/or data environment and work to find solutions to fix the root cause. This will also include working with business and IT stakeholders to help them articulate issues and turn reported issues into concise development requirements to close the issue/gap. This role will strive, with the rest of the data team, to make sure the business intelligence solutions are prioritized, built, tested, and deployed in a timely manner.

Duties & Responsibilities:

Serve as a technical data liaison between business users, systems, and analytical teams
Assist in the planning and development of a requirements attainment strategy for new business intelligence projects. Engage business and IT stakeholders to elicit requirements.
Develop BI use cases, requirements, POCs, as needed to meet business intelligence needs across the organization.
Design, develop, and maintain complex SQL queries and support ad-hoc requests for the creation of BI reports and dashboards.
Collaboration with IT and other business teams on Business Intelligence solutions to review and test solutions to ensure effective implementation.
Responsible for providing production support triage as needed, coordinating/validating changes within the data environment.
Support and maintain current Business Intelligence tools and solutions.
Build and expand business intelligence skill set. As new processes and/or tools are introduced into the data environment, work to learn new technologies and methodologies to enable support. Work to understand tools and processes across the entire data pipeline, enabling the identification of root causes across any step in the data pipeline.
Assist with the development of test strategies, writing and executing functional test cases, developing test execution plans, assessing defect severity, providing a status of testing activities and driving defects/issues to resolution.
Improve business acumen as it pertains to the insurance industry and/or develop functional domain expertise within BI related disciplines (e.g., database design, report/dashboard design, statistical modeling, etc.).
Leverage business knowledge and expertise to drive business process improvements.

Education & Experience:

Bachelor's degree in a technical field (Mathematics, Computer Science, Statistics, etc.), or equivalent.
3+ years of experience in data and reporting-related roles in an insurance or financial industry setting
Demonstrates success working with data discovery, analytics, visualization, and business intelligence tools such as SSRS, PowerBI, BusinessObjects, etc.
Thorough knowledge of relational database theory, data warehousing concepts, terminology and architecture, and SQL (creating tables, views, stored procedures, indexes, etc.)
Experience analyzing and interpreting information from multiple sources, resolving conflicts, and reconciling user requests with system functionality and business needs
Basic level proficiency with query performance tuning

None

Job Description

This role is designated as a hybrid role which includes working at least 3 days per week (Tuesdays, Wednesdays, Thursdays) in one of our main offices located in Oak Creek, WI, Deerfield, IL, Maumee, OH, North Olmstead, OH to foster better collaboration, connection, and innovation.

The Senior Consumer Insights Analyst is responsible for cleansing and analyzing consumer data from internal research studies and external data sources such as brand awareness studies, consumer journey research, website traffic, product registrations, etc. and providing recommended insights and actions to key business leaders in the organization. The Senior Consumer Insights Analyst will also be responsible for driving organizational understanding of consumer preferences, demographics, and behavior.

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

Collect, analyze, cleanse, and visualize both internal and external data on consumer and end-user demographics, preferences, needs, and buying habits to identify business insights and opportunities.
Synthesize Voice of Customer (VOC) and other research data into actionable insights that help brand, category management, channel marketing and other internal partner teams evaluate product opportunities and go-to-market strategies.
Manage the tracking and reporting of key metrics and insights to the organization, including brand health and awareness, net promoter score, consumer engagement, etc.
Work with global brand development team to establish KPIs and then provide reporting, dashboards, insights, and recommendations based on these KPIs to help improve organizational understanding of consumer preferences, demographics, and behavior.
Cleanse market research data using data pivots, joins, unions, etc. into a user friendly and ingestible format using tools such as Tableau Prep.
Partner with the Data & Analytics teams to deliver new certified data sources enabling consumer insights and automated visualizations.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Business, Statistics, Economics or related field.
3 years’ experience in data collection and analytics working with marketing and brand teams, market research, consumer insights, or manufacturing product preferred.
Ability to analyze data and draw meaningful conclusions.
Skilled in a range of analytic methods to support an array of marketing and business needs, includingfrequency and crosstab analysis, clustering and factor analysis, regression analysis and modeling, segmentation, etc.
Experience with data visualization software and analysis software (i.e. Tableau, Power BI, SPSS)
Experience with data cleansing software (i.e. Alteryx, Tableau Prep, etc.)
Experience with website analytics platforms (i.e. Google Analytics, Shopify, etc.) and CRM or CDP tools preferred.
Must have initiative and ability to work independently.
Possess clear written and presentation skills with ability to confidently present insights to business stakeholders.
Must be able to work in fast paced environment and handle multiple projects effectively.
Must be able to work cross-functionally throughout the global organization.
Strong communication skills with the ability to tell stories that persuasively deliver key insights

HOW YOU WILL DO IT
Purpose Statement: Business Analysts provide Customer Service Excellence by helping customers implement technology solutions in a cost-effective way, determining the requirements of a project or program, communicating them clearly to stakeholders and solutions development, and helping end users test and deploy the solutions.

Work with business partners to elicit high-level requirements and business needs, followed by articulating those into documented business requirements and demands. Assist with prioritization exercises by providing cost and effort estimation/analysis. Manage the priority of demands to map them appropriately into a process focused functionality roadmap.
Contribute as a global team member as part of the overall application delivery process. Represent customers by collaborating with all IT Teams (e.g. Infrastructure, Development, Support) to ensure that business requirements are understood and that solutions meet expectations.
Understand business processes and systems for assigned customer areas and act as a liaison for the customer area between IT, product teams, and the customer.
Manage and successfully deliver moderate to high complexity projects. Apply broad knowledge to identify and resolve core problems.
Additional Accountabilities:
Create detailed process diagrams to demonstrate desired functionality (as needed) and participate in requirements reviews and walkthroughs to communicate customer needs and expectations and assist in coordination of User Acceptance testing (UAT).
Regulatory Compliance: Ensure that solutions support Plexus and customer policies surrounding key controls and compliance, such as SOX, ITAR, EAR, FDA, and others as appropriate by properly specifying these needs as part of the overall delivery of requirements.
Technical Currency: Remain current on Plexus business, industry and IT technology trends in order to provide forward looking solutions
Focus on continuous improvement - personal, the team, and processes. Develop, discuss and adapt to those enhancements and changes.
Actively participate in and sometimes lead Functional User Groups and similar meetings by sharing common problems and solutions across multiple sites/regions and providing user request updates.
Additional duties as assigned.

Description

The Milwaukee Metropolitan Sewerage District (MMSD) is a regional governmental agency that serves 1.1 million people in the greater Milwaukee area. MMSD provides water reclamation, flood management, and green infrastructure services for our community. Our mission is to protect public health and the environment through world-class, cost-effective water resource management, leadership, and partnership. Join our diverse team and support your community while protecting our environment.

MMSD is seeking qualified candidates for the position of System Monitoring Data Analyst in the Water Quality Protection Division. Reporting to the Conveyance Systems Data Supervisor, you will ensure the timely processing of all MMSD monitoring data from various network databases, maintain related applications, perform quality assurance on all data maintained by the System Monitoring Department (SMD), and create and process reports according to MMSD policies and procedures.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Ensure database systems and respective interfaces are processing and collecting data for MMSD programs and initiatives supported by the SMD. Alert appropriate personnel regarding any missing or erroneous data and assist in its recovery.
Organize and maintain databases to ensure data integrity and work with the Information Technology Services Division on long-term planning strategies for data warehousing.
Identify malfunctioning assets and create and distribute maintenance requests to appropriate personnel to maintain functionality and minimize data loss.
Ensure functionality of all departmental applications used by the SMD throughout importing, quality assurance, and reporting processes. Interface with appropriate personnel to minimize down time and loss of data.
Participate in quality assurance data activities in support of MMSD programs or initiatives maintained by the SMD. Review data and notify laboratory personnel/Field Monitoring staff of any suspected erroneous or missing data for proper documentation, revision, or re-analysis. Assist in the regulatory reporting process.
Provide complete, timely, and quality assured data requests. Follow-up with data requestors to ensure that the data has been received and answer any questions the requestor may have about the data.
Perform daily tasks related to conveyance system performance, including weather station data.
Provide process improvements that promote the automation of data collection, quality assurance, and documentation.
Act as a technical resource for report development in HACH WIMS and support users of other SMD applications and databases.
Perform MMSD data retention activities according to MMSD policies and procedures.
Assist in keeping all SOP's current.
Complete special projects as assigned.

Marginal job duties: Travel to remote facilities to train personnel in new database/software applications. Accompany field crews to observe monitoring and data collection techniques to better understand field procedures and involvement.

Qualifications

Bachelor of Science degree in environmental sciences, computer science, data science, or civil/environmental engineering.
Two to three years of job-related experience; or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Knowledge of and the ability to apply software, databases, and programming to the solution of business problems.
Ability to track data for proper collection in databases.
Working knowledge of the operation of sanitary sewer, combined sewer, and stormwater collection systems.
Working knowledge and experience in Word, Access, Excel, Adobe, GIS, SQL, and/or related software.
Computer software proficiency.

Supplemental Information

Position Title: Business Data Analyst

At E15, we are the spark that ignites. Our team delivers next-generation insights based on data, not hunches, to drive business in healthcare, campus, corporate, sports, entertainment, hospitality, and retail industries to help companies make forward-looking decisions to benefit their business and their guests. For more information on what we are about as a company, check us out by following the link below: www.e15group.com

Job Summary

The Business Data Analyst is a senior analyst position on the E15 analytics team within Levy. As a Business Data Analyst, you would become E15’s primary point of contact with Levy's operators and clients at Fiserv Forum with the Milwaukee Bucks. You would conduct several data-driven projects, including performance reporting and economic valuations, and serve as project manager for others, including the strategic deployment of E15’s proprietary analytics products.

Responsibilities
Managing relationships with key client and Levy stakeholders and understanding their overall strategies and business objectives
Developing specific knowledge about other like venues, including physical configuration, technology and operational processes
Identifying opportunities to optimize existing product offerings, distribution, and pricing
Reporting periodically on operational and financial metrics, and creating an economic valuation of E15’s bottom-line impact
Communicating key guest insights and industry trends
Performing quarterly & annual partner reviews
Supporting new business bids
Managing or directly completing ad hoc analytics projects as appropriate
Partnering with E15’s data engineering team to maintain data accuracy & cleanliness for proper analysis
Observe food and beverage operations on gamedays to better understand bottlenecks, points of friction, and identify further areas of opportunity through contextualizing the data.

Qualifications
Bachelor’s (or higher) degree in business analytics, computer science, statistics, economics, finance, or a related field
At least 1 year of work experience as an analyst (Business/Financial/Data). In the food and beverage and/or sports/entertainment industry is preferred.
Experience (work or school assignments) in at least one of the following tools:
SQL
Statistical software package (R strongly preferred)
Data visualization (Tableau strongly preferred)
Expertise in Excel modeling, with work or school experience in financial modeling a plus
Experience using data visualization tools, visual features of statistical software tools or PowerPoint to communicate complex ideas to non-technical audiences
Specific interest (or prior experience) in client service
Strong communication and presentation skills
Can share examples of working effectively in a team environment
Can share examples of how they have used data to solve complex problems
Can share examples of how they have used creativity to achieve excellent outcomes

Your Job

KBX is seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst who will work closely with members of Support, Operations, Purchasing and Business Development teams to evaluate trends though the design and development of reports and the analysis and interpretation of data using, SQL, Microsoft Power BI, SSRS, Excel and a variety of development and visualization tools. This includes the development of database tools, data analysis to evaluate the service and cost of KBX, and provision of data support for various programs and ad hoc reports.

Our Team

The Business Intelligence and Automation team, comprising 10 diverse members with various skills and experiences, fosters inclusivity as a central tenet. Regardless of backgrounds, our team values every member's input, creating an open and respectful work environment. Collaboration is a cornerstone of our approach, involving not only internal teamwork but also engagement with stakeholders and customers. We actively seek feedback and embrace challenges, reflecting a growth-oriented mindset. We excel in striking a balance between being independent and interdependent work, making us a dynamic and effective group for achieving outstanding results in various projects and tasks.

What You Will Do

Create and deliver analytics to operations and the business to lower our total transportation cost and improve dedicated utilization
Dive into the data and systems to understand what is driving\impacting the key metrics and results
Interpreting results using a variety of techniques, ranging from simple data aggregation via statistical analysis to complex data mining
Writing queries to extract data and build visualizations/analytical models to support business needs and fulfill business requirements
Designing, developing, implementing, and maintaining business solutions
Synthesizing large amounts of information while maintaining rigorous attention to detail
Collaborating with business requestors and IT developers to implement new enhancements and innovations; understanding the implications enhancements will have on data structures and query effectiveness
Reviewing data and reporting to ensure data integrity and compliance to standard reporting
Leverage SQL or other programing languages to structure data to extract and organize consumable data sets
Effectively influence, communicate, and build relationships with teammates, internal and external customers
Develop data visualization tools in Power BI and SSRS to enable users to find key trends

Who You Are (Basic Qualifications)

Experience writing complex transactional data queries to integrate into other applications via languages such as R or Python or SQL
Experience using math and analytical skills in a professional environment
Experience working with Microsoft Office Excel writing complex formulas, pivot tables and vlookups
Experience articulating and educating data findings to customer or stakeholders
This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship

What Will Put You Ahead

Associate degree or higher
Experience with the use of Microsoft Power BI for data visualizations
Experience integrating data via Microsoft Power Automate solutions
Experience leveraging data from SnowFlake
Experience writing technical queries in Python or R
Experience in the analytical or logistics industry

Introduction

It is the mission of the Wisconsin Department of Justice (DOJ) to protect the public and ensure that justice is done. To continue to meet this mission, the principles of equity, inclusion, and employee well-being have become a foundation for all work performed at DOJ, on behalf of Wisconsinites.
The DOJ is committed to developing and supporting a workforce and culture that is rich in diversity and innovation. It is the department’s goal to ensure that all DOJ employees are empowered to be authentic, claim belonging, and thrive. This is your opportunity to make and be the difference. Click here to learn more about DOJ.
This is a Limited Term Employment (LTE) position. LTE positions do not automatically lead to permanent state employment or enjoy the same benefits as permanent employees; however, these positions do offer valuable work experience and an opportunity to learn more about career opportunities with the Department of Justice and the State of Wisconsin.
The Wisconsin Department of Justice (DOJ), Division of Criminal Investigation (DCI), is looking for highly motivated and talented individuals to join our team. DOJ is currently recruiting for a Cyber Intelligence Analyst (Criminal Analyst)-LTE to join the Special Operations Bureau, Wisconsin Statewide Intelligence Center (WSIC) office located in Madison, WI . LTE appointments are limited to 1,039 hours per 12-month period. It is anticipated that this position will work part-time (approximately 20 hours/week) and allows for flexible work hours. DCI positions are not eligible for remote work.
The deadline to apply for this job announcement is Wednesday, November 29, 2023, at 11:59pm. For any questions, please contact Angie Rizner, Human Resources Specialist at rizneram@doj.state.wi.us or (608) 347-9393.
Position Summary

This entry-level WSIC Cyber Intelligence Analyst position will provide intelligence support related to cybersecurity events throughout the state. The analyst will gather, receive, analyze, and disseminate intelligence related to malicious computer activity. The analyst will use dynamic and static analysis to investigate suspicious and malicious network traffic and files. The analyst will assist in the production and dissemination of technical finished intelligence products to WSIC stakeholders. The analyst is expected to work in close coordination with members of the public, the private sector, as well as government officials at all levels. The analyst will contribute expertise to various working groups, and act as a resource for law enforcement and government agencies across the State. The duties of this position will have a direct impact on the WSIC’s daily operations and the coordination of information sharing between state, federal, local, and tribal law enforcement agencies, as well as private sector partners.
Salary Information

The Criminal Analyst-LTE position is in pay schedule 07 and pay range 04. The starting pay will be $20.00/hour. Pay for current or former state employees will follow the provisions found in the State of Wisconsin Compensation Plan.
Job Details

SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS: Travel to other agencies and meetings including court appearances is required. Travel out-of-state may be required. This position must testify in an effective manner as an expert concerning the analysis performed and the results and conclusions drawn. Testifying in an effective manner requires remaining free of Brady or Giglio obligations. The analyst is expected to deploy to provide analytical support to law enforcement in a variety of circumstances.
The Department of Justice does not sponsor work visas at the time of hire or anytime during employment. All persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and complete the required Employment Eligibility Form I-9.
An extensive background check, including fingerprints, drug screening and psychological will be completed on all DCI applicants prior to selection.
Qualifications

Please address the following in your resume and/or letter of qualifications:
Well-qualified applicants must have education, training and/or experience in the following: Developing actionable intelligence through collection, analysis, and research OR investigating information from multiple sources to identify trends, anomalies, or solutions. Preparing reports or presenting information as a result of research and analysis. Using computer software such as analytical tools, spreadsheets, visualization programs, databases, forensic software, or other specialized tools to organize and analyze data.
How To Apply

Apply online! To apply, click on “Apply for Job” to start the application process. Once logged in, click “Apply for Job” and follow the steps outlined in the application process. You will be required to submit a letter of qualifications and resume.
Each time you apply for a job; you should update and tailor your resume and letter of qualifications. You should clearly describe your education, training, and experience related to the items listed in the “Qualifications” section of the job announcement. These qualifications should be addressed in your resume and expanded upon in your letter of qualifications. This will allow a fuller assessment regarding your qualifications and those required for the job in which you are applying.
Your resume should include the following: Your educational background including any course work that relates to the position in which you are applying. Your employment history, including experiences and/or duties and a summary of accomplishments and skills learned or used. Any training or experience, including volunteer work or internships, you have related specifically to the “Qualifications” section of the assessment. Spell out any acronyms and/or abbreviations the first time used.
Your letter of qualifications should include: Additional information regarding your past work experience, including volunteer work and internships, or coursework. Highlights of your most relevant skills and experiences as they related to the specific job in which you are applying. Specific examples that clearly demonstrates your level of expertise.
What not to include in your resume or letter of qualifications:
Your application materials should not include any information that is not job-related, such as race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, creed, disability, or genetic information. Further, do not include any self-identifying information such as photos, social security numbers, political affiliation, citizen status or conviction records.
Application materials will be evaluated, and the most qualified applicants will be invited to participate in the next step of the process. References will be requested from top candidates once interviews have taken place.
NOTE: Current/former State employees interested in a permissive transfer, demotion or reinstatement consideration must also apply.
The State of Wisconsin is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer seeking a diverse and talented workforce. Veterans, women, people of color, LGBTQIA+, and people with disabilities are encouraged to apply. We provide reasonable accommodations to qualified applicants and employees with disabilities.
We appreciate the time and effort it takes to apply for positions. If any questions arise, please contact Angie Rizner, Human Resources Specialist, at rizneram@doj.state.wi.us or (608) 347-9393.
Deadline to Apply

The deadline to apply for this job announcement is Wednesday, November 29, 2023, at 11:59 PM .

Network Health’s success is rooted in its mission to create healthy and strong Wisconsin communities. It drives the decisions we make, including the people we choose to join our growing team. Network Health is seeking a Risk Adjustment Data Analyst. This individual is responsible for supporting the critical data functions for the Risk Adjustment Department. Performs analysis, design, coding, testing, and maintenance of data imports and extracts while remaining compliant with all Center for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) and Health and Human Services (HHS) laws, guidance, regulations and standards. Takes part in the detection and correction of data errors. Responsible for standard monthly reporting, ad hoc requests, as well as the development, coding and testing of new reports. Participates in internal and external data audit activities. Responsible for the ongoing maintenance and enhancements for the Risk Adjustment coding tool. Provides analytical support on various strategies to ensure organizational goals are met.

Job Responsibilities:

Develop, test, run and maintain monthly, quarterly, and annual risk adjustment reports and conduct or participate in department audits.
Create and submit supplemental data files for Medicare Advantage and ACA-qualified lines of business.
Coordinate the maintenance and enhancements for the Risk Adjustment coding tool.
Provide data analytics and reporting support for internal and external audits.

Job Description

Are you curious, motivated, and forward-thinking? At FIS, you will have the opportunity to work on some of the most challenging and relevant issues in financial services and technology. Our talented people empower us, and we believe in being part of a team that is open, collaborative, entrepreneurial, passionate and above all, fun.

Join the 2024 FIS University Program!

As a 2024 FIS University Program full-time employee, you will have the opportunity to participate in team projects, community service activities, professional development seminars and work with a team that is invested in your growth, development, and success; including bi-annual performance connects with your manager.

This two-year full-time program has start dates in January, March, June, and September with a dedicated “Learning Week” where you will:

Learn how to work within a corporate environment
Learn about the exciting world of Fintech and the role FIS plays
Hear from FIS leadership about their journey and participate in senior leader networking opportunities
Build a network of your peers from across the organization

This position is for a June 24, 2024 start.

About the team

The Business Process Improvement Team serves the Value-Added Services division which focuses on products that supplement our client’s payment products – e.g. fraud prevention, loyalty, disputes. This exciting team focuses on projects and efforts that improve the effectiveness of our product’s operations, driving down cost, risk, client complaints and improving overall efficiency. We do this through innovations in technology such as AI, Analytics, Robotics Process Automation (RPA) and other cutting edge automation technologies, business process improvements, etc. We love to solve problems and help drive the business forward.

What you will be doing

Assisting in the development of dashboards and other analytics tools that will help provide better business insights for better decisions.
Learning and analyzing process mining tool outputs and mining this data for opportunities for automation and business process improvement.
Collaborating with other members of the business process improvement team to assist with automation and process improvement projects.
Collaborating with operations and product to provide needed analytics and data to support operational management and client requests.
Analyzing loss data to identify key trends and causes of loss.
Learning internal databases to improve data outputs and analyses.

What you bring

Bachelor’s degree in relevant field of study
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite
Fluent in English; Strong written and verbal communication skills
Adaptability, a drive to learn, and strong problem-solving skills
Ability to work well independently and within a team
Documented experience with business intelligence tools such as Power BI, SAS, SPSS, Tableau and experience developing dashboards and other analytical outputs.
Skill with interpreting data into actionable insights.
SQL and other programming background
Curiosity

Bonus if you have

Business courses or other interdisciplinary background
Developer coursework

What we offer you

Competitive salary and excellent benefits
The chance to work on some of the most challenging, relevant issues in financial services & technology
A broad range of professional education and personal development possibilities – FIS is your final career step!
Time to support charities and give back to your community
A work environment built on collaboration, flexibility, and respect
Student Loan Repayment Program: FIS will PAY OFF participants’ undergraduate loan balance over 10 years of service! Eligibility starts after one year of tenure in the program. The benefit applied to undergraduate student loans for US-based degrees and must be in the employee’s name.

*Current and future sponsorship are not available for this position*

The Campaign Data Analyst and Researcher provides support by utilizing the Blackbaud Raiser's Edge/NXT (Re7/NXT) donor database while executing and developing database queries and reports, spreadsheets for various communications, as well as data analysis and troubleshooting issues on behalf of the users. This position will also conduct prospect research and provide exceptional customer service to all stakeholders, in alignment with Viterbo's mission and guiding principles.

Please note: This position is Full time, 12-month, Non-exempt and is approved for the campaign period of 5 years ending December 31, 2028.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Work closely with the Vice President of Advancement and Senior Director for Donor Relations and Advancement Services to produce campaign gift reports, dashboards, action reports, prospect reports, and mailing lists.
Research prospective donors utilizing prospect research platforms and data seeking techniques.
Serve as lead when wealth screening efforts are conducted to assist campaign.
Provide operational support regarding portfolios hosted by Advancement staff, President, identified Cabinet members and Athletic Director.
Assist in developing queries based on current strategy for accurate lists, gift reports, and campaign planning.
Assist in daily maintenance and enhancement of all constituent records using Re7/NXT.
Maintain accuracy, integrity, and security of all data; performs imports and exports, and other data coding.
Contribute to goal setting and the refinement of processes and procedures.
Performs other duties, as assigned.

General Requirements/Qualifications:

Baccalaureate degree preferred, or three years of related experience.
Experience with the Raiser's Edge database or a comparable CRM system.
Ability to understand internal business processes, database management best practices, and how they relate to functionality within Raiser's Edge and Financial Edge.
Experience using various technology and programs, including Microsoft Office and specialized computer software and applications.
Ability to be a creative thinker, and an excellent problem-solver to improve and maximize existing software.
High level of attention to detail, organizational, administrative, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
Effective time management with the ability to manage multiple projects.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
Excellent customer service skills.
Must be authorized to work in the United States. Viterbo University is unable to sponsor or take over the sponsorship of the employment Visa.

Physical Demands: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to handle or feel and talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. The employee is expected to meet and perform the physical requirements and to work effectively in an environment which is typical of this position.

To Apply: Please complete the online employment application form, upload a letter of interest, salary requirements, CV/resume, and three professional references.

Review of Application: The review of applications will be ongoing until the position is filled.

About the University: Viterbo University is a Catholic, Franciscan, liberal arts institution with an enrollment of nearly 3000 students. Viterbo is located in scenic La Crosse, Wisconsin, which has been rated as one of the top places to live in the US. Opportunity

Reporting to the Manager- Logistics Solutions this position is responsible developing and driving solutions that will improve operational performance, quality and customer satisfaction. The position will also support DC productivity metrics, inventory slotting, automation utilization and CI project management. Additionally, the Logistics Analyst will work to maintain inventory accuracy through reconciliation between SAP and Blue Yonder.


Specific Responsibilities

Functional skills:

Develop, implement and manage CI processes and initiatives
Train and motivate front line operators towards achieving quality, productivity and service targets.
Utilize Lean and other CI tools to identify areas of improvement and develop solution action plans.
Identify Industry and network best practices that can be documented and implemented across the DC network
Use a variety of data sources, including SAP and Blue Yonder to identify trends and improve efficiency through slotting/re-slotting items to balance workload and maximize throughput
Analyze data to identify consolidation opportunities to support and assist building leadership with capacity management
Analyze Automation utilization, capacity and throughput to improve mechanical and systems productivity.
Monitor outside/offsite storage inventory when applicable
Research quality claims, identify root cause and provide recommended solutions

Skills/Requirements

Bachelors degree in Supply Chain, Logistics, Engineering or Management
2-3 years experience in Logistics Operations, Warehousing, Manufacturing or other front line operations business.
Experience in Lean/Six Sigma or other continuous improvement initiatives is highly preferred
Candidate should also have excellent leadership and communication skills, as well as the ability to engage and motivate cross-functional teams.
Basic knowledge in SAP, JDA/Blue Yonder WMS systems preferred.
Microsoft Skills (Excel, Outlook, Word, PowerPoint) are required. Accelerated MS-Excel experience is preferred.
Excellent written, verbal and organizational skills are required.
