The Data Analyst is responsible for understanding business requirements and designing data models to transform raw data into meaningful insights. They will be responsible for designing data pipelines and infrastructure, developing reports and dashboards, interpreting data, and communicating to technical and non-technical audiences. The individual in this role must be analytical and resourceful, have excellent communication skills, and can work directly with end users and stakeholders.


ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:

Develops professional-quality business intelligence, data visualization, and analytics content in support of OSIS’s strategic priorities, using Power BI and Crystal Reports.
Provide Subject Matter Expertise (SME) support in common functions of the BI technologies including reporting, analytics, analytical processing, data transformation, and data.
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements, such as automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
Optimizes performance and usability of Power BI reports and dashboards by tuning queries, implementing efficient data models, and applying best practices.
Collaborates with business stakeholders to understand their requirements, translates them into technical specifications, and designs efficient and visually appealing Power BI reports and dashboards.
Provides a high level of internal and external customer service.


REQUIRED EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

BS degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering, or equivalent experience
Minimum 2 years of demonstrated experience developing accurate, effective, and appealing visualizations using Microsoft Power BI.
Knowledge of Power BI application security layer models
Proficient in SQL, T-SQL, and SQL Server Management Studio
Strong Knowledge of DW architecture and ETL frameworks
Understand relational Database concepts, including normalization and query optimization


PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:

Experience using Azure Data Factory (ADF), building and managing data pipelines to enable the flow of data into an Azure-based Enterprise Data Platform
Experience developing reports with Crystal Reports
Familiar with Azure DevOps, Agile development, and Git


TELECOMMUTING AND TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS:

This position is a remote role.

Must have:
Cable or Fiber Internet Service
Download speed of 20Mbps or higher
Upload speed of 5Mbps or higher

Hoffmaster Group Inc, is an industry leader producing the most complete line of specialty disposable tabletop products for over 75 years. Hoffmaster competes in three distinct business segments – Foodservice, Consumer, and E-Commerce. Our products can be found in thousands of retailers, restaurants, hotels, and more. As a customer centric company, we strive to deliver innovative solutions to both our customers and the ultimate end users of our products. This Innovation is a key part of what we do here at Hoffmaster, and we continue to drive the industry forward by investing in our employees and state-of-the-art technology..

This is not a remote postion

Primary Purpose of the Role

As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will be responsible for gathering, analyzing, and visualizing data to help Hoffmaster make data-driven decisions. You will work with various data sources, tools, and technologies to provide insights that support strategic planning and operational improvements.

Essential job Duties

Collect, clean, and integrate data from various sources, such as databases, spreadsheets, and external data providers, to create a unified dataset for analysis.
Perform in-depth data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies. Use statistical and data mining techniques to uncover insights.
Create clear and concise reports, dashboards, and data visualizations to communicate findings and insights to stakeholders.
Provide actionable insights and recommendations to support decision-making, strategy development, and process improvements.
Develop and implement predictive models to forecast future trends and outcomes.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity by implementing data validation and data quality processes.
Assist in establishing data governance practices, data standards, and best practices within the organization.
Conduct ad-hoc analyses and research to address specific business questions or challenges.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including IT, business units, and management, to understand their data needs and deliver solutions.
Required Skills and Abilities

Strong understanding and experience working with relational databases, especially in Microsoft SQL Server
Experience with Microsoft Azure
Knowledge of data modeling, ETL technologies (T-SQL, SSIS, SSAS) and data warehouse design theory (Kimball data modeling/Inmom)
Experience building solutions in Power BI
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Effective oral and written communication skills
Ability to balance multiple projects
Detail oriented and organized
Self-motivated
Ability to work independently or as a member of a team of technical professionals
Minimum of an associate degree in Information Systems, Computer Science or other related technical discipline
Minimum of two years developing business intelligence solutions

SUMMARY OF POSITION:
Analyze data to achieve the Accounting department’s goal of providing consistent and accurate financial information to all areas of KMC. In addition, provide recommendations to Management to improve margins and overall profitability. Contribute towards the various aspects of the Accounting department responsibilities including month-end close, standard costing, budgeting and year-end audit.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
This list of duties and responsibilities is not all-inclusive and may be expanded to include other duties and responsibilities, as management may deem necessary from time to time.

Analyze, summarize, and prepare recommendations to all levels of Management regarding actual and forecasted results, taking into account KMC’s corporate strategy and goals (Company-wide, Department and Individual).
Prepare and analyze sales and margin reports by customer and part. Research margin issues and communicate results.
Make recommendations to management regarding cost saving opportunities.
Participate in month end close and year end audit. Prepare journal entries, account reconciliations and assist with financial statement analysis.
Create and maintain standard part cost records through established processes. Review unusual or unexpected outcomes with the appropriate personnel and propose recommendations to correct errors.
Review monthly Standard Cost Activity Report (SCAR) for standard cost variances and unusual transactions. Determine appropriate course of action to correct, as needed.
Analyze changes in raw materials, manufacturing methods or services provided to determine effects on costs.
Prepare daily, weekly, and monthly inventory reports used by Management to monitor levels and related inventory activities.
Assist in excess and obsolete inventory investigation. Coordinate inventory disposal and perform appropriate transactions.
Assist the Director of Accounting in the development of the budget, forecasting, and other corporate financial requirements.
Maintain fixed asset records. Track and evaluate capital expenditures and depreciation.
Participate in the annual physical inventory.
Prepare the annual Real Estate and Personal Property Tax returns.
Perform duties with minimal errors. Detect errors while performing routine tasks, correct the errors and develop methods to systematically prevent future errors.
Other duties as assigned or required.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Currently, the position has no supervisory responsibilities.

We are seeking a talented and self-motivated individual to join our team as a Fixed Income Capital Markets Business Analyst. This individual will be involved in both recurring and project based duties that span Finance, Operations, Compliance and Legal, Marketing and PR, Business Development and Client Services. The ideal candidate will have a strategic viewpoint and self-motivation to tackle multiple tasks at once.

As a Business Analyst, you may:

1. Analyze business trends, metrics, and results for the Fixed Income Sales & Trading and Public Finance businesses.

2. Prepares executive level presentations, receiving guidance from the leadership team.

3. Complete research on potential recruiting opportunities and prepares financial models. Analyze profitability by product line.

4. Perform month end reconciliations, prepares commission reports and payout summaries.

5. Provide ongoing support to the Sales & Trading team members with commissions and P&L variance issues and questions.

6. Assist in building and tracking the budget and managing expectations for many teams within the department.

7. Work closely with members of Baird’s Finance and Operations teams and other internal clients to ensure efficient operations.

8. Become the relationship contact between local office and Baird Real Estate (CREW) team for any and all real estate changes (i.e., new offices, expiring leases, etc.)

9. In collaboration with FICM Accounting Coordinator, ensure timely and accuracy in processing invoices, expense reports, receivables and performs deal reconciliations. Prepare deal summaries.

10. Business Continuity (BC) plan owner working directly with the BC team on a quarterly basis to maintain plan documents and provide appropriate testing along with communication during live ‘disasters’.

11. Tracks vendor spend, reports on it by product group

What makes this opportunity great:

1. Compelling careers working side-by-side with the best in the business.

2. Team of associates passionate about achieving great results for clients and giving back to the communities where we live and work.

3. Unique culture that values diverse backgrounds and perspectives while emphasizing teamwork and a strong sense of partnership.


What we look for:


1. Bachelor’s degree in Finance or Accounting.

2. 3-5 years of experience.

3. Advanced computer skills including Excel, Word, Power Point and Outlook.
4. Must obtain FINRA licenses SIE, 7, 50, 52, 63 within 2 years of start date and FINRA 24, 53, 54 within 4 years of start date.

5. Natural curiosity, self-driven motivation to learn and interest in the Fixed Income markets required.

6. Strong interpersonal communication skills, both oral and written. A high level of professionalism is mandatory.

7. Excellent grammar, editing and proofing skills required. Attention to detail and positive can-do attitude a must.

8. Ability to prioritize and handle multiple tasks simultaneously, often under pressure and/or short deadlines.

9. Willingness and ability to work additional hours as needed to ensure work is completed in a timely fashion.

10. Ability to tolerate peak workloads, multiple assignments and produce results with accuracy and reliability.

11. Demonstrates a calm demeanor and retains composure in stressful situations.

12. Ability to initiate action and work independently on most tasks.

13. Ability to maintain confidentiality and professionalism with sensitive project information.

Overview:

Business Intelligence Analyst Description & Duties:

The Business Intelligence Analyst will on a regular basis develop data-driven recommendations and present to senior management to improve business strategies and practices.


Duties may include, but are not limited to:

Responsibilities:
Dive into data and quickly become an expert on internal and non-traditional data sets. Use creativity and problem-solving acumen to identify trends and drive adjustments to our underwriting capabilities.
Develop performance reporting in Tableau and other media, present results to cross-functional teams and executive leadership.
Gather information for business intelligence from sources, such as market research reports, public records, field reports, or purchased findings. In addition to gathering information about customers and the market, grow and apply your knowledge of pertinent technological trends or emerging markets in our industry.
Examine data to provide market and financial intelligence reports that drive the critical path of the company.
Develop recommendations to improve returns, grow profitable loan originations and present results to executive leadership.
Gather information on issues, making recommendations for fixes to improve system performance and process efficiency.
Ensure risk and pricing models are soundly developed, accurately tested, and continually benchmarked.
Identify new insights, including external data sources that differentiate loan performance.
Assist with generating company performance through project cost-benefit analyses.
Other duties as assigned by management. Must be able to come to work promptly and regularly. Must be able to take direction and work well with others. Must be able to work under the stress of deadlines. Must be able to concentrate and perform accurately. Must be able to react to change productively.

The Ideal Candidate:

Applicants must be reliable, dynamic, sociable and enthusiastic team players; while possessing a positive "can-do" attitude, excellent judgement and communication skills. Applicants must also have great attention to detail and ability to multi-task under the stress of deadlines with a strong desire to help the organization succeed.
Qualifications:
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in finance, Mathematics, Engineering or similar quantitative field is required; master’s degree preferred.
Minimum 4 years’ experience in data analytics
R or Python 3+ years’ experience required, Tableau 3+ years’ experience required, Math & Statistics 3+ years’ experience required, SQL/VBA a plus.
demonstratable advanced use of Tableau.
Certified Analytics Professional (CAP®) is a plus.

DLF USA Inc. North America SBU is currently recruiting for a HRIS & Operations Analyst.

DLF Group is the world leader in the development and sale of high-quality grass seeds for the agricultural and professional lawn market. By continuously developing new innovative varieties and products, and with a strong focus on quality and reliability, DLF Group offers demonstrable value to the business of their customers and other relationships.

DLF North America SBU, is one of our four Strategic Business Units. DLF employees are characterized by a high level of competency, passion, and commitment. Together with an entrepreneurial mindset and a flat organization, this contributes to DLF’s unique agility.

We turn science into growth! Come grow with DLF! Get on our grass!

Check us out at www.dlf.com (corporate site choose Canada & U.S.A.).

About the role

The HRIS & Operations Analyst will manage the day-to-day SuccessFactors (SSF) HR HCM modules, support the execution of annual activities, and provide configuration and testing assistance related to SSF HR enhancements and implementations. The role will focus on the execution of HR system administration activities, including processing activities, reviewing existing system configuration settings such as notifications and leveraging reports. The incumbent will have the opportunity to work with other teams within and outside of our Global HR to support HR systems and process enhancement projects.

The ideal work model is hybrid home and our office in Lacrosse, Wisconsin.

Key responsibilities:

· Address HRIS system-related questions through troubleshooting, configuration and design of business processes, workflow, security, and report modifications

· Effectively collaborate with teams such as HR, Talent, Recruiting, Technology, Finance, and others to provide support for requests such as enhancements, defects, and new functionality

· Conduct needs assessment, performs GAP analysis on SuccessFactors, leads business process modeling and helps the business develop “to-be” business processes

· Engage external vendors to troubleshoot configuration requirements, as needed

· Support the Global HR team with annual cycle system administration tasks Examples: Employee Engagement Surveys, Performance Reviews, Compensation process, Learning Management Systems

· Own the SharePoint site about the HRIS - SSF/People System

· Conduct regular analysis to ensure data accuracy, including the use of Excel functions such as VLOOKUP, leveraging reports for data reconciliation efforts and random spot-checks of HR data

· Document and maintain HRIS and business user guides

· Provide training and support for HRIS

· Look for efficiency gains in our processes and partner with team members to prioritize

· Provide support for the input of daily transactions into our HR systems as required

· Develop, create, and maintain a variety of reports

Qualifications for the ideal candidate:

· Post-secondary degree or diploma from an accredited college or university in Information Technology

· Post-secondary degree or diploma from an accredited college or university in Human Resources Management

· Minimum 3 years SAP SuccessFactors HRIS/HCM systems functional experience, or combination of education and experience

· Extensive knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite, particularly MS Excel, including advanced formulas, Pivot Tables, exports/imports, etc.

· ⁠Familiarity with human resources policies and procedures to ensure the HRIS meets organizational needs and goals & strong business aptitude for HR systems functionality

· Self-managing and results-oriented

· Excellent organizational skills

· Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

· ⁠Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to train and explain concepts and technologies to all levels of the organization

· ⁠Impeccable attention to detail to help maintain our HR architecture, processes, security, and data integrity

· ⁠Ability to work well in structured and unstructured environments, under pressure, and with changing and competing priorities and timelines

· Works well with small teams to take responsibility for and lead projects from start to finish

· 10% travel International (Canada, USA, Europe)

Compensation and Benefits:

This position comes with a competitive compensation plan that includes a base salary, competitive benefit & retirement plans and many other perks. Compensation will be based on experience.

If you meet the above qualifications and are interested in joining our DLF team, please send your resume and cover letter highlighting your talent and why you fit this role to karen.baird@dlf.com or apply on Indeed.

It’s an exciting time to be part of the West Bend team! In this role you will provide management and analysis of business data for use in decision making and organizational efficiency improvement initiatives. This role will give you the opportunity to provide leadership, coaching and/or mentoring to others in the department.

The Department of Health Services (DHS), Division of Medicaid Services (DMS) is filling a Program and Policy Analyst - Advanced position at Milwaukee Enrollment Services (MilES). MilES serves residents of Milwaukee County to determine eligibility for Medicaid, BadgerCare Plus, FoodShare, and other income maintenance assistance programs.

As an employee of the State of Wisconsin, you'll also have access to an amazing benefits package, including:

3.5 weeks of vacation, 9 paid holidays and ample sick time.

Top rated health plan options starting at $39/month for single plans and $97/month for family plans, after 2 months of state service.

Participation in the Wisconsin Retirement System, which is considered among the best in the country!

Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program employer.

Our diversity, equity and inclusion team strives to hire, develop and retain a talented workforce representative of the people of Wisconsin. We are searching for people with diverse backgrounds to join our dynamic and team-oriented environment. We promote professional growth and create a healthy work/life balance and inclusive culture.

Click here to see what working for the State of Wisconsin is all about!

This position will report to the office at 6055 N. 64th Street. on a scheduled rotation. Currently the schedule is a 4-week rotation: 1 week in the office and 3 weeks working remotely. This schedule may vary based on operational needs.

Position Summary



In this position, you are primarily responsible for analyzing and reporting data on program and department objectives for Wisconsin’s Medicaid, BadgerCare Plus and FoodShare programs in order for MilES management to make informed data driven decisions regarding future agency direction.

Income Maintenance Specialists, at the local county level, use the Client Assistance for Re-employment and Economic Support (CARES) system to determine eligibility for Medicaid, BadgerCare Plus and FoodShare. Eligibility criteria are programmed into the CARES system, which processes applicant information entered by state agency workers. This is a very complex system that currently supports four major public assistance programs: Wisconsin Works (W-2), FoodShare, Child Care and Medicaid. The social security administration, through various system interfaces, also affects Medicaid eligibility for elderly persons and persons with disabilities. Implementing policy in this highly automated and complex environment requires that analysts have solid analytic and programmatic skills.

You will work independently and with teams, sometimes in a leadership role, to improve and strengthen the Department’s ability to successfully monitor and report on Income Maintenance program performance data. Working with the agency’s management and with other program staff, this position has responsibility for key aspects of program data monitoring such as:

Using database and spreadsheet tools to extract, collect and analyze data from large relational databases
Designing data collection tools
Participating on management information committees
Providing input into design and improvement of data collection tools and processes
Designing and producing both routine and ad hoc program reports
Identifying and assisting in utilizing data for improvement and management decisions
Continuously improving the ability to report accurate and timely data for decision-making


Salary Information



Pay for this position is between $35.00 to $37.86 per hour (approximately between $72,800 and $78,700 per year) depending on qualifications, plus excellent benefits. A 12 month probationary period is required.

Pay for current or former state employees is set based upon the rules that apply to compensation for the applicable transaction. The position is in pay schedule and range is 07/03.

Job Details



All applicants who may be appointed to this position will be required to allow DHS to conduct a background check to determine whether the circumstances of any conviction may be related to the job being filled.

For positions that do allow remote working flexibility, although residency in the State of WI is not required for permanent positions, it is not anticipated that working outside of WI or bordering cities will be allowed as positions may at times need to report to office locations in WI on short notice.

Employees must have access to secure high-speed internet for remote work option. Mileage reimbursement to the employee’s headquarter location is not provided. Remote work flexibility will be discussed in more detail during the interview process.

DHS does not sponsor work visas for this position, thus, in compliance with federal law, selected candidates will be required to verify eligibility to work in the United States by completing the required I-9 form upon hire.

Qualifications



Minimally qualified applicants will have all of the following:

Experience interpreting and applying laws and/or policies.
Experience collecting and/or researching information from a multitude of credible sources.
Experience performing quality improvement processes (e.g., basic quality improvement, Lean, NIATX, etc.).
Experience providing technical assistance, consultation, and/or training related to quality improvement.
Experience developing and presenting complex informational materials.

Well-qualified candidates will also have one or more of the following:

Quality improvement experience in public assistance or social work field.
Formal training in project management and/or change management.
Experience analyzing performance management or operations metrics.
Experience as an inspector or official to ensure regulations and rules are being followed.

NATURE AND SCOPE
Reporting to the AVP, Card Product Management this position is responsible for leveraging data to develop reporting with the goal of attracting and retaining cardholders, monitoring performance, and identifying trends within the product. You will also be responsible for performing market analysis contributing to pricing, product, and promotional recommendations. This position also analyzes promotional data for profitability and retention and makes recommendations accordingly.

REQUIREMENTS
1. Bachelor’s degree and two years of card services analytical experience preferably within financial services. An equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered.
2. Five years of analytical experience and proven ability to conduct thorough credit card market analysis is preferred.
3. Demonstrated ability to develop systematic reports, analyze data, identify trends, and make program recommendations based on the trend data.
4. Proven ability to present data and program recommendations in a clear, concise, and professional manner to multiple levels of leadership.
5. Excellent verbal and written communication, problem solving, attention to detail, organizational skills, and the ability to work independently.
6. Proficient with excel, sequel, or data warehouse management. Understanding of how to build proforma and profitability models.
7. Must develop a thorough understanding of company policies and procedures as they relate to this position. Must comply with all company policies and procedures and all job-related state and federal laws and regulations.

PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES
1. Conduct market analysis related to pricing, product, and promotions to make recommendations to support Landmark’s card growth strategies.
2. Monitor spending to identify and report usage trends with the goal of attracting and retaining cardholders.
3. Works with Marketing and third-party business partners to analyze and manage promotional data for profitability and make recommendations accordingly.
4. Works within the databases of Pulse, Fiserv DNA, Visa, Fiserv Client Central, and Marquis.
5. Provides feedback to management through various reports and presentations in a manner which is clear, professional, concise, and easily understood.
6. Performs other duties as assigned.

JOB SUMMARY:

The Business Intelligence Reporting Analyst help drive critical business decisions by analyzing metrics and designing reports. They communicate these results to managers and often provide suggestions based on their findings. The Business Intelligence Reporting Analyst assists will take on advanced reporting needs and assist departments with the development of desktop dashboards for reporting Key Performance Indicators (KPI’s). The position assists department staff with developing new reports, learning basic and advanced features of the BI tool and conducts training classes periodically to improve all departments reporting skills. This position also makes tables available to departments for reporting, runs necessary jobs to keep data current and assists in creating data dictionaries for cloud based system APIs.



ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Performs administrative functions of Tableau to assure available data is ready for reporting.
Creates and publishes advanced reports and dashboards on a project basis; gathering specifications, designing reports / dashboards, and offering suggestions for enhancements.
Coordinates with departments to test reports for accuracy and intent.
Supports departments in the development, editing and enhancement of their own reports and dashboards.
Provides necessary training to departments to allow users to create their own reports and dashboards.
Ensures programming and reporting activities are well-defined and remain within scope. Takes initiative in working with internal staff to redirect when necessary.
Reviews, monitors, and analyzes department reporting efforts.
Utilizes technology to better measure, monitor and communicate KPI’s to key MCTS staff and stakeholders and works in conjunction with IT staff to ensure adequate business processes are in place to capture key performance data.
Coordinates internal involvement with industry bus benchmarking group (ABBG) to ensure accurate reporting, timely responses and dissemination of best practices and industry updates.
Contributes expertise to the development and delivery of performance management documents, policies and procedures.
Performs other related duties as assigned.


QUALIFICATIONS:


Bachelor’s degree in business, engineering, planning, programming or relevant field. Extensive work experience may be accepted in lieu of degree requirements.
Minimum of five (5) years’ experience analyzing data.
Minimum of three (3) years’ experience using Business intelligence reporting tools.
Minimum of two (2) years’ experience using Tableau software.
High degree of computer literacy and demonstrated ability to integrate technology in the workplace.
Experience working within public transportation preferred.



KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:

Excellent verbal and written communication skills and a demonstrated competency to interact with people at all levels of the organization.
Highly developed organizational, analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to visualize data and connections between Key Performance Indicators and goals.
Demonstrated initiative, flexibility and ability to work with minimal supervision and the ability to multi-task and prioritize work.
Knowledge of desktop dashboards, report writing software or similar programs.
Proficient in Microsoft programs such as Excel, Word and Power Point, and experience with reporting tools such as Tableau, Microsoft Power BI and/or Oracle Business Intelligence Enterprise Edition
Knowledge of data mining methods and “big data” reporting.
Ability to maintain effective working relationships with staff and stakeholders, as well as to work effectively as a team member in a diverse environment.
Ability to train users with limited experience in reporting tools.



PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS AND ENVIRONMENTAL FACTORS:

Work is frequently conducted an office or similar indoor environment relatively free from unpleasant environmental conditions or hazards. Incumbent is sometimes located in an outdoor, vehicle, warehouse or shop environment.
Physical requirements are those described as sedentary work exerting 10 pounds of force occasionally or a negligible amount of force frequently.

About the role

The HRIS & Operations Analyst will manage the day-to-day SuccessFactors (SSF) HR HCM modules, support the execution of annual activities, and provide configuration and testing assistance related to SSF HR enhancements and implementations. The role will focus on the execution of HR system administration activities, including processing activities, reviewing existing system configuration settings such as notifications and leveraging reports. The incumbent will have the opportunity to work with other teams within and outside of our Global HR to support HR systems and process enhancement projects.

The ideal work model is hybrid home and our office in Lacrosse, Wisconsin.




Key responsibilities:

Address HRIS system-related questions through troubleshooting, configuration and design of business processes, workflow, security, and report modifications
Effectively collaborate with teams such as HR, Talent, Recruiting, Technology, Finance, and others to provide support for requests such as enhancements, defects, and new functionality
Conduct needs assessment, performs GAP analysis on SuccessFactors, leads business process modeling and helps the business develop “to-be” business processes
Engage external vendors to troubleshoot configuration requirements, as needed
Support the Global HR team with annual cycle system administration tasks Examples: Employee Engagement Surveys, Performance Reviews, Compensation process, Learning Management Systems
Own the SharePoint site about the HRIS - SSF/People System
Conduct regular analysis to ensure data accuracy, including the use of Excel functions such as VLOOKUP, leveraging reports for data reconciliation efforts and random spot-checks of HR data
Document and maintain HRIS and business user guides
Provide training and support for HRIS
Look for efficiency gains in our processes and partner with team members to prioritize
Provide support for the input of daily transactions into our HR systems as required
Develop, create, and maintain a variety of reports



Qualifications for the ideal candidate:

Post-secondary degree or diploma from an accredited college or university in Information Technology
Post-secondary degree or diploma from an accredited college or university in Human Resources Management
Minimum 3 years SAP SuccessFactors HRIS/HCM systems functional experience, or combination of education and experience
Extensive knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite, particularly MS Excel, including advanced formulas, Pivot Tables, exports/imports, etc.
⁠Familiarity with human resources policies and procedures to ensure the HRIS meets organizational needs and goals & strong business aptitude for HR systems functionality
Self-managing and results-oriented
Excellent organizational skills
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
⁠Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to train and explain concepts and technologies to all levels of the organization
⁠Impeccable attention to detail to help maintain our HR architecture, processes, security, and data integrity
⁠Ability to work well in structured and unstructured environments, under pressure, and with changing and competing priorities and timelines
Works well with small teams to take responsibility for and lead projects from start to finish
10% travel International (Canada, USA, Europe)



Compensation and Benefits:

This position comes with a competitive compensation plan that includes a base salary, competitive benefit & retirement plans and many other perks. Compensation will be based on experience.

Job Summary
As part of the Campus Planning team within the Facilities, Planning & Management (FPM) division, the Data Analyst oversees the ongoing, cyclical collection, input, and management of campus space-related data. The position will design and implement relevant data tracking and reporting to ensure the collection of clean, reliable data in support of campus long-range planning efforts including the development of the biennial capital budget. The data analyst will liaise with relevant FPM and unit data users to bridge the collection of relevant building and utility data. Collaboration, communication, and teamwork are essential skills for the position, necessary to support successful collaboration with campus stakeholders.

The Data Analyst is part of the Campus Planning team which manages the development of the biennial capital budget, the implementation and management of campus capital projects, and the advancement of the long-range campus plan in coordination with FPM, leadership, and campus stakeholders. Sustainability and Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) are integral to campus efforts.

Work will be performed primarily on the UW-Milwaukee campus, with requests for remote work considered after the initial training period. Hybrid work options may be available with specifics regarding work location requirements discussed during the interview process.

Experience using spreadsheet and relational database software to organize, review, and analyze data
Experience synthesizing data through writing

Job Title: Senior Analyst Business Analyst- Corporate Partnerships
Job Description:
A strategic key player, working with cross-functional partners in the planning, coordination, analysis, communication and execution of large scale corporate project strategy initiatives.

ACCOUNTABILITIES

ANALYTICS AND INSIGHT DEVELOPMENT

Lead analysis in key strategic projects/initiatives
Research and synthesize industry trends, competitive conditions, best practices and benchmarks to create insights and inform strategies
Identify, obtain, and analyze required data to support strategy approach and development. Organize and analyze data using statistical and other methods to ensure validity of results
Build quantitative analysis that is based on data inputs, solid calculations, and reasoned high-level interpretation including ROI/Financial Modeling
Distill insights from analyses and translate them into recommendations and clear conclusions that inform strategy development. Structure solutions to complex business problems and provide analytical insights
Define, collect and update critical performance metrics from cross-functional partners for communication to relevant business partners
Help identify the tools and design the processes needed to implement new business ideas and concepts
Effectively communicate analysis results and collaborate with cross-functional partners to effectively deliver analytics and insights that inform strategy
Assess financial opportunities through different vantage points for proposed benefits partnering closely with FP&A and Finance Partners
Capital and expense budgeting and forecasting accountability

EFFECTIVE CORPORATE PARTNERSHIP

Provides thought leadership cross functionally to ensure all aspects of the project are considered, monitor to identify and resolve critical business issues
Escalate issues in a timely fashion to the appropriate project stakeholders
Analyze business operations, conduct business process analysis, identify priorities and partner with management to gain alignment
Gain knowledge of the business areas supported so as to add value to projects/portfolio being managed

CROSS-FUNCTIONAL COMMUNICATION

Build strong relationships and rapport with internal cross-functional partners
Communicate the results of research and insight development in a clear and structured way, support the development of engaging presentations
Support business partners in the curation and communication of pre-read content for the executive committee
Build subject matter expert network in the organization

QUALIFICATIONS

REQUIRED

3-4+ years experience in strategy, finance, project management or a related field
Strong problem solving and analytical skills
Strong presence and professionalism
Highly proficient with applicable technology systems/tools (e.g. Tableau, PowerPoint, Excel and Google suite)
Work with cross-functional teams in a highly collaborative way to build relationships throughout all levels of the organization
Comfortable with ambiguity and non-linear process
Effective communication skills (both verbal and written)
Strong problem solving and analytical skills, combined with business judgment to drive insight/action
Ability to prioritize and organize multiple tasks in a fast paced environment, with attention to detail

PREFERRED

Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Finance, Project Management or a related field
Experience in retail, research, strategy, analytics, large scale process improvement
Experience with applicable technology systems/tools (e.g. Google Suite, MS PowerPoint, MS Excel, Tableau, SQL)

The Maximo Business Analyst will provide leadership and support in delivering technology and information solutions that enhance productivity, lower costs, and improve information delivery for Operations in NEI’s three p. By identifying improvement opportunities in Maximo systems and focusing on developing solutions, the Company expects to maximize value from technology investments. Maximo Business Analyst Essential Functions

Occasional travel may be required to other NEI sites.

Join our team! We have an exciting opening for a full-time Lead Business Analyst to join our team in Madison, Wisconsin!

The role of a Lead Business Analyst is focused on providing Business Analysis services independently for multiple projects of any size. As a BA, you will take deep dives into a client’s business, understand the client’s domain and their business needs, and work to design and create a solution alongside Yahara’s engineering staff. Business Analysts are critical in orchestrating the development by writing user stories, updating the product roadmap, and representing the client users in scrum agile meetings. The following can be expected of a Lead Business Analyst at Yahara Software.

Experience:

Job Qualification

Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field or equivalent BA experience.
Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively verbally, as well as through written word and formal presentations.
Demonstrated interpersonal, collaborative, and relationship-building skills.
Proficient in the use of technologies such as Zoom, Slack and Skype for remote professional communications.
Demonstrated high degree of initiative and ownership; proactively works to resolve issues.
Demonstrated ability to build trust and create lasting relationships. Must have experience working on a team.
Demonstrated ability to escalate timely to technical lead, management or client and work effectively to eliminate roadblocks.
Experience working with Waterfall and Agile Methodologies and understanding and flexibility to know when to use appropriate methodology or practices.
Able to learn new technology well enough to communicate with technology experts.

General Job Duties

Conducting requirements-gathering sessions with numerous stakeholders for what the future-state solution should provide.
Analyzing complex business problems and assessing how automated systems can be leveraged to help solve them.
Formulating and defining the stakeholders’ objectives into a recommendation of potential solutions.
Researching the client’s market competitive advantages and disadvantages and what external pressures may apply from the project manager and working those into the overall solution design.
Organizing the requirements into feature-sets and prioritizing them into ‘mandatory’ versus ‘desired’ buckets.
Building functionality proposals in collaboration with Technical Lead.
Converting requirements and solutions designed in collaboration with Tech lead into stories in support of development activities such as estimating, development and testing.
Tracking requirements as they progress through development activities.
Supporting the project manager in the creation of key client-facing deliverables such as the product roadmap, Return on Investment metrics, and budget snapshots.
Utilization of rapid prototyping tools such as JustinMind, Sketch, or Zephyr to facilitate development and maximize usability of application features.
Utilization of requirements analysis tools such as flow charts, sequence diagrams, entity relationship diagrams, fishbone diagrams etc.
Working as liaison between Yahara and its clients to facilitate, encourage, motivate User Acceptance Testing, gathering testing feedback, prioritizing bug fixes, and negotiating acceptance from the client.
Provide guidance to Project Coordinators to lead scrum cadences such as stand ups, backlog grooming and estimation, sprint planning and sprint close demos.
Identifying project risks and escalating to project manager from the product development point of view.
Assisting sales department to write responses to requests for proposals (RFP’s.)
Staying up to date and incorporating learnings from IIBA, or other industry standard entities, for software development best practices.

About Regal Rexnord

Regal Rexnord Corporation (“Regal Rexnord”) is a leading manufacturer of electric motors, electrical motion controls, power generation and mechanical power transmission products and sub-systems, serving customers around the world in the general industrial, consumer, commercial construction, food & beverage, and alternative energy end markets, among others. Regal Rexnord sells its products and solutions to OEMs, through distributors, and directly to end-users. Regal Rexnord is a $7.2B company with 36,000 associates globally.
You may not know it, but Regal Rexnord impacts your life every day. The company’s products enable the fans in HVAC systems that keep us comfortable; the power source that keeps smart buildings running; the agricultural and food service equipment that keeps us fed; and the conveyer systems that keep e-commerce flowing, to name a few of the applications where our products are used.
Regal Rexnord’s business purpose is to create a better tomorrow by energy-efficiently converting power into motion. This means creating innovative solutions while focusing on both customer needs and the company’s commitment to sustainability. The company’s industrial powertrain and automation solutions offerings are an important part of the company's growth strategy. The company’s strategy includes leveraging 80/20 to prioritize all activities, including product excellence, operational excellence and commercial excellence (i) driving organic sales growth through the introduction of innovative new products, with a particular focus on improving energy efficiency, (ii) establishing and maintaining new customers, as well as developing new opportunities with existing customers, (iii) participating in higher growth end markets and geographies, and (iv) identifying and consummating strategic, value creating acquisitions.

We’re looking for those individuals—the creative thinkers and innovation seekers—who are content with nothing short of changing the world. Work alongside subject matter experts to acquire deep understanding of CIBMTR data domains and data use to support data analysis and use.
Collaborate with technical resources to perform data profiling, root cause analysis and complete remediation of data quality issues.

Provides technical support for application software.

Knowledge of computers, electronics, digital media, databases, applications, software development, risk management, and information security.
5 years of experience with EDI/FHIR/HL7 platforms & technologies and knowledge of Healthcare Industry standards and requirements.
Strong data analysis and profiling skills along with uncompromising commitment to preserve data quality and integrity.
Strong knowledge of data modeling principals and data standards.
Knowledge in HL7 standard data transfer formats and FHIR® formatted XML and JSON objects and need to know how to read and write functionality works based on the GET/PUT/POST/DELETE functions used in web-based APIs.

As one of the largest mutual insurance companies in the US, Sentry is committed to offering coverage at a competitive price and provide outstanding service and support. To provide our competitive products, it takes an effective team. We’re currently seeking a highly self-motivated individual to join our commercial lines team as a Product & Compliance Senior Analyst to support the needs of our business stakeholders effectively and efficiently. As a Product & Compliance Senior Analyst, you’ll leverage your organizational and interpersonal skills to affect operations within lines of business while growing your insurance knowledge and ensuring corporate compliance.

This position will be located in a Hybrid work model at either our Home Office in Stevens Point, WI or our office location in Edwardsville, IL and is not a fully remote opportunity.

What You’ll Do

There are three major roles you’ll support as a Product & Compliance Senior Analyst: supporting state insurance products for Sentry’s Commercial lines niches, communicating implementation and availability of new or enhanced products, and participating in projects focused on key improvement initiatives. Within these roles you’ll:

Implement and communicate strategic plans for markets by working with internal partnerships

Conduct market and competitive analyses to take advantage of market opportunities

Create, maintain, and file exhibits and requests with the State for changes to products

Lead filing projects and communicate status to various stakeholders

Work as a team player to analyze markets, data, and trends

Communicate results to the team and management

Announce product rate, rule, and form updates to the impacted business areas

Oversee consistency and accuracy of filing projects for assigned lines of business

Interpret compliance related matters/language/bulletins and implement a course of action in accordance with requirements.

What it Takes

Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience

2+ years of related work experience

Prior insurance background with experience in underwriting, rating, or product filings preferred

Understanding of Microsoft Excel to create and manage spreadsheets

Ability to collect and analyze data and trends and clearly communicate their results

Insurance coursework such as CPCU, AINS or ARM is beneficial

Strong interpersonal communication and analytical skills are essential

What You’ll Receive

At Sentry, your total rewards go beyond competitive compensation. Below are some benefits and perks that you’ll receive.

Sentry is happy to offer flexibility through a scheduled Hybrid work model. Monday and Friday work from home if you choose to, Tuesday through Thursday in office.

As a Sentry associate, you will have an in-office workspace and materials for your home office. In addition to the laptop you will receive prior to your start, Sentry will provide equipment for your home office.

Meal Subsidy available for associates who report to an office:

Offices with a cafeteria, $5.00 daily stipend

Offices without a cafeteria, $15.00 weekly stipend

401(K) plan with a dollar for dollar match on your first eight percent, plus immediate vesting to help strengthen your financial future.

Continue your education and career development through Sentry University (SentryU) and utilize our Tuition Reimbursement program.

Generous Paid-Time Off plan for you to enjoy time out of the office as well as Volunteer-Time Off.

Group Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Parental Leave, and our Health and Wellness benefits to encourage a healthy lifestyle.

Well-being and Employee Assistance programs.

Sentry Foundation gift matching program to encourage charitable giving.

We take great pride in making Forbes’ list of America’s Best Midsize Employers since 2017. A lot of different factors go into that honor, many of which contribute to your job satisfaction.

Our bright future is built on a long track record of success. We got our start in 1904 and have been helping businesses succeed and protect their futures ever since. Best, the industry's leading rating authority.

Company Description


About Veolia North America:

A subsidiary of Veolia Group, Veolia North America (VNA) offers a full spectrum of water, waste and energy management services, including water and wastewater treatment, commercial and hazardous waste collection and disposal, energy consulting and resource recovery. VNA helps commercial, industrial, healthcare, higher education and municipality customers throughout North America. Headquartered in Boston, Mass., Veolia North America has approximately 10,000 employees working at more than 350 locations across the continent. Please visit our website www.veolianorthamerica.com.



Job Description


Benefits:

Veolia's comprehensive benefits package includes paid time off policies, as well as health, dental and vision insurance. In addition, employees are also entitled to participate in an employer sponsored 401(k) plan, to save for retirement. Pay and benefits for employees represented by a union are outlined in their collective bargaining agreement.

Position Purpose:

In this role, the HR Data & Reporting Analyst is responsible for gathering, structuring, and analyzing data to support Veolia’s Talent analytics and reporting needs. This role supports the development and automation of standard HR data reports, analyses, and dashboards leveraging report software from multiple systems. This position will collaborate primarily with HR but also across business functions to manage reporting, analyze trends in data, and make recommendations to the leadership team, in order to drive strategic decisions or satisfy business requirements.

Primary Duties / Responsibilities:

Gather, structure, and analyze data from multiple sources, presenting the results of data in a secure, usable format.
Build reliable, accurate and cross-matched reports for data research, troubleshooting, and data audits.
Design, develop and manage new reports and dashboards designed to provide management a view into people HR metrics and ensure the timely development and distribution of established periodic reports. aligned with data privacy policies and secure delivery methods.
Collaborate with technical staff, providing feedback and user/technical specifications, regarding the design of reports and dashboards for leadership.
Perform analysis of data gaps and work with relevant stakeholders to recommend solutions.
Research and troubleshoot data issues to ensure data quality.
Expand and enhance analytics capability, continue to improve processes, explore/adopt new tools. Collaborates with various business partners on project requests, prioritization and delivery.
Uses business applications (PeopleSoft, Workforce Software) and statistical/analytical tools to develop interactive presentations and data visualizations.

Work Environment:

This is a hybrid position
Position can be based in either Milwaukee, WI or Paramus, NJ
Occasional travel as needed.


Qualifications


Education / Experience / Background:

Bachelor’s Degree in business, finance, analysis, HR preferred or equivalent experience.
Two (2) or more years analysis, business analyst, research experience or related required.

Knowledge / Skills / Abilities:

General knowledge of Human Resource and Payroll practices.
Ability to exercise sound discretion and maintain strict confidentiality regarding PII and reporting.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, including data interpretation, logical thinking, and timely, practical decision-making.
Strong knowledge in Excel; Google applications a plus (Mail, Docs, Sheets, Charts).
Self-motivated with strong organizational, planning and follow-up skills.

Position Summary:

The Sr. BA will play a lead role in the evaluation of Jewelers Mutual’s current systems and processes by identifying and communicating needs between business areas, technology teams and support teams. Supports one or more moderately to highly complex business processes. Serves as a team member, sometimes as a technical lead. Also works at a high level to analyze business area needs, then recommends and defines solutions to address business challenges and desired outcomes.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES & REPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

Planning & Execution Activities

Determines which techniques and artifacts should be used for each project based upon size, complexity and stakeholders
Identifies all stakeholders
Helps communicate and mitigate risks to ensure project success
Responds to changing organizational priorities
Works closely with project managers and assists with the project planning
Provides input from a business and IT perspective
Conducts data gathering and analysis to understand business strategy requirements
Contributes to the business short-and long-term planning sessions and provides direction to ensure understanding of business goals and direction
May generate appropriate communication, process and educational plans for mitigating the disruption of change
May identify and remove obstacles to change

Requirements Gathering

Ensures stakeholders are involved in requirements gathering activities
Obtains needed information from stakeholders to form requirements
Captures information provided in formal and informal meeting environments
Prepares requirements documentation in format understandable to the recipient audience
Ensures requirement traceability through all phases of a project / program
Strives to eliminate ambiguity in, or varying interpretations of requirements
Assesses stakeholder needs utilizing a structured requirements process to assist in identifying
business priorities and advises on options
Develops, writes, and communicates business requirements and functional specifications for the implementation of business solutions

Analysis, Management & Communication

Obtains, organizes and categorizes large amounts of information provided by stakeholders
Critically evaluates information gathered from multiple sources, reconciles conflicts, decomposes high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguishes user requests from the underlying true needs.
Documents the business requirements and functional specifications which express what actions the business must take in order to solve a business need and delivers work artifacts through the project lifecycle
Ensures that all requirements and designs support the delivery of value, fulfill goals and business outcomes
Offers input on priority of requirements based on time, cost, scope, strategic fit and return on investment
Obtains approvals for each artifact generated
Analyzes and articulates impacts of changes to requirements
Appropriately responds to changing requirements
Identifies opportunities for improvement and proposes solutions to impacted areas
Takes ownership of conflict and issue resolution
Coaches and transfers knowledge to less experienced team members.
Keeps stakeholders informed of problems, issues, and resolutions
Varies communication method / style based on stakeholder or group
Understands organizational culture, structure and impact on work efforts
Understands enterprise architecture concepts and can assess business capability needs
Effectively identify, understand and communicate business impacts/outcomes across the organization functioning as a business architect/enterprise analyst
Establishes and maintains liaison relationship with business units and IT in order to provide effective technical solutions
Seeks opportunities to improve and deepen relationship between IT and business units
Analyzes performance metrics to ensure stakeholder satisfaction.
Manages stakeholder expectations
Analyzes stakeholder operations to understand their strengths and weaknesses to determine opportunities for improvements
Provides assistance in business case development (i.e., research, data collection)
Reviews test plans
Monitors testing process to ensure that business results are adequately tested with minimal risk
Ensures test strategies involve appropriate integration and process components
Provides a concise list of solution options considered including a recommended solution
Assesses the organizational readiness for the new solution
Outline business capabilities and requirements to move from the current to future state
Verify and validate that proposed solutions meet business needs / outcomes
Assists in the business process redesign and documentation as needed for new technology.

Education and/or Experience

A Bachelor’s degree from a four-year college or university. Equivalent work experience in a similar position may be substituted for educational requirements.
Ideal candidates will have a minimum of five to seven years of increasingly responsible experience in information technology with an emphasis on business architecture & business analysis.
Experience in gathering and/or developing requirements for multi-channel / omni-channel digital marketplaces, B2B portals & B2C portals.
Property/casualty insurance, financial services and/or jewelry industry experience is desired, but not required.

Computer Skills

Proficiency in common Microsoft applications, including MS Office Suite, Visio, SharePoint and Outlook. Working knowledge of project management applications, Mind Mapping Software, and prototyping applications (e.g. Photoshop, Dreamweaver, Azure, iRise, Microsoft Expression Studio).

Certificates, Licenses, Registrations

Certified Business Analyst Professional (CBAP) certification and/or Usability (UX) Certifications are desirable.

POSITION SUMMARY U.S. Venture is looking to hire a Benefits Analyst to join our Total Rewards Team! In support of U.S. Venture's values and strategies, this role coordinates, administers, and ensures compliance of our health and retirement programs. The Benefits Analyst serves as the primary liaison with vendors on eligibility, claims, and billing matters. This role will develop employee communication and education related to benefit programs and recommends plan changes and establishes governance to support the HRIS and HR Operations teams. The Benefits Analyst will develop reports and analyzes data to help understand trends and make data-driven decisions.

This position will work at our Corporate Headquarters in Appleton, WI with a hybrid work schedule.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
Administers the Company’s total reward programs such as 401k, medical, dental, disability, vision, life insurance, voluntary benefits programs, flexible spending, and health savings accounts including ancillary programs such as vacation and sick time.
Manages compliance related to total reward programs, including summary plan descriptions, notices, summary annual reports, ACA forms, and other mandated disclosures.
Coordinates periodic team member educational workshops and prepares supplemental educational material, creating awareness of programs.
Facilitates new hire benefit communications.
Updates and maintains total reward content on the Company’s intranet site.
Primary point of contact for total reward-related inquiries from team members.
Prepares eligibility files and related records for vendors.
Maintains eligibility tracking for COBRA and retirees.
Creates and audits vendor reports and prepares analysis to identify trends and requested HR metrics.
Responsible for the preparation of annual compliance reports including but not limited to non-discrimination testing, 5500 filings, 1094/1095 ACA filings, QNECs, summary annual reports, internal and external audit requirements, plan documents, summary plan descriptions, and approvals.
Manage service level agreements and performance guarantees at the contract level; hold benefit partners accountable for the agreed upon deliverables and ensure partners are held accountable on a day-to-day basis.
Manages annual benefits enrollment period, 401(k) audit, 401(k) auto enrollment, and 401(k) and FSA non-discrimination testing.
Partners with HRIS on workflows and development of new automated processes related to total reward programs.
Provides ongoing bi-weekly and monthly audits reconciling applicable supporting financial transactions to the Company’s benefit programs and HR data.
Lives our values of High Performance, Caring Relationships, Strategic Foresight, and Entrepreneurial Spirit.
Finds A Better Way by championing continuous improvement and quality control efforts to identify opportunities to innovate and improve efficiency, accuracy, and standardization.
Continuously learn and develop self professionally.
Support corporate efforts for safety, government compliance, and all other company policies & procedures.
Perform other related duties as required and assigned

QUALIFICATIONS

Required:
Fundamental knowledge of human resources concepts, practices and procedures with 2-3 years of related experience
Attention to detail, accuracy, and deadlines
Proven customer service and organizational skills
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Advanced working knowledge of Microsoft Office, report writer skills, and prior HRIS experience (Workday is preferred).
Ability to work independently, in addition to being a positive team player who thrives in a busy work environment
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to travel 15-25%

Preferred:
Associate degree in human resources, accounting, or business management required; bachelor’s degree with emphasis in human resources, accounting, or business management preferred; PHR, CBP and/or CEBS preferred
Advanced knowledge of various benefit plan types (Medical, Rx, Dental, Vision, FSA, HRS, Dependent Verification, Pension, 401K, Life, Disability, FMLA, STD, LTD, Military leave, etc.).

Job Summary：

Trane Technologies is hiring a Supply Chain Analyst in La Crosse, WI. The Supply Chain Analyst is responsible for evaluating production and inventory performance, collecting and analyze data to suggest improvements, plan and implement optimization projects.

The incumbent will oversee KPI’s for production scheduling procedures, inventory planning procedures, and warehouse management procedures; collaborate with IT professionals and supply chain professionals to improve and standardize business processes; develop tools, reporting and standard work to optimize business performance. Research best practices and seek to improve all aspects of the supply chain by reviewing current methodology and processes.

The Supply Chain Analyst is also responsible for coordinating new product introductions, managing phase-in / phase-out activities, and maintaining PFEP data and inventory optimization parameters.



Responsibilities:

Create processes and methods to gather supply chain data.
Analyze data to identify areas of supply chain operations to improve efficiency.
Develop and execute projects to enhance supply chain operations.
Establish and maintain relationships with engineering, procurement, operations, and IT teams.
Identify and analyze supply chain trends. Track KPIs and report on supply chain’s performance.
Analyze supply chain risks and develop strategies to resolve the concerns.
Perform inventory analysis, prepare reports, and recommend actions.
Manage PFEP data including procurement, packaging, storage and delivery methods.
Support continuous improvement of supply chain processes and procedures.
Actively participates in lean projects, A3 problem-solving projects and Kaizen events.
Provide training and support to supply chain teams.
Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in supply chain management, logistics, business, or engineering.
A minimum of 8-10 years of experience in manufacturing and supply chain functions.
Strong data analysis skills, proficient with ERP and MES systems.
Oracle experience preferred.
APICS CPIM certification preferred.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Experience with rate-based or flow line (non-MRP) and job shop manufacturing environments.
Experience in operations management, inventory management, and lean manufacturing.

Key Competencies:
To perform this job successfully, an individual must balance multiple priorities, maintain technical expertise and achieve results through systems. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required.

Must be a flexible, decisive, and proactive problem solver.
Must be able to work well in high pressure, fast-paced environment.
Must be a strong communicator.
Must possess strong organizational skills, with ability to work on multiple priorities at once.
Must have solid interpersonal skills and the ability to motivate staff and to interact with various departments throughout the organization.
Must be resourceful, can find solutions to unusual problems and meet customer needs.
Ability to work independently.
Ability to work well in a team environment.

Benefits kick in day one!
6% 401K match, plus an additional 2% of eligible pay in core contributions.
3 weeks of vacation per calendar year, plus paid holidays.

Collaborate with Local, Regional, State, Federal, & Private partners: Collaborate with technical and non-technical partners and subject matter experts to set data strategy, identify opportunities for process improvements, recommend system modifications, and develop policies for data governance.

Current resident of the state of Wisconsin

At least three (3) years of recent experience in Data Analytics, Epidemiology, Data Science, or Statistics.
At least three (3) years of experience in data analytics and reporting for decision-making.
At least three (3) years of experience in visualizing data, including the use of a business intelligence tool, preferably Power BI

At least one (1) year of experience working with large datasets and data management systems.
Strong communicator, collaborator, and relationship-building required.

Previous experience working with advanced data analysis and modeling.

You Are:

This role is for a Business Analyst who will function as a liaison between Sales and marketing business partners and the IT organization to provide technical solutions to meet business requirements. This role will also bring industry-specific process and functional knowledge, as well as best practices into the development of technical solution design for the SAP TPM initiatives, especially in the SAP Trade Promotion Management (TPM), Trade Claims Management (TCM), Trade Fund Management (TFM) and Customer Business Planning (CBP) modules, along with TPM reporting.


The Opportunity :

Collaborates with Digital Strategy and transformation leads, business process owners, and end users to clearly identify and understand business needs and requirements.
As needed, support business process redesign for new technology introductions.
Identifies and evaluates application options to meet business needs worldwide, referencing client-specific and industry trends as well as application roadmap planning.
Supports the development of reliable cost estimates of all components required to deliver application solutions.
Translates business requirements into functional specification packages and manages changes to such specifications.
Prepares comprehensive test plans for the introduction of new applications or functionality to ensure expected outcomes and minimize the risk of business disruption.
Provides diligent oversight of development execution and testing by on-site or offshore external resources.
Works with the outsourced support partner to identify, develop, implement, test, and support changes and/or enhancements to the SAP system and reports, utilizing best practice project management principles and standards.
Understands and analyzes business processes and functions to identify opportunities for continuous improvement including standardization and automation.
Ensures the system change requests adhere to the SAP Global template and Change Control guidelines and do not break existing configuration and custom programs
Ensures existing applications are performing to service levels, utilized, at relevant versions, and meeting client security and audit requirements.


This position description identifies the responsibilities and tasks typically associated with the performance of the position. Other relevant essential functions may be required.


What you need:

Have a minimum of 6 years overall IT experience
Minimum of 2 Years of relevant working experience in Trade Promotion Management Business Analysis
Bachelor’s degree in computer science or Management Information Systems or related business degree.
Experience with IT Business Analysis

Description:

Under the direction of the General Manager, the Business Analyst will serve as a vital link between manufacturing and business processes. Duties for this position will include detailed requirements analysis, documenting current and future state business processes, advising on potential process improvements, planning and coordinating user acceptance testing and system integrations. This position will manage projects related to systems, which include our ERP, production and shipping systems. This is a non-supervisory position.



Gather and analyze project requirements using various methods such as analytical, interviewing, and data gathering techniques; understanding of current systems and analysis of business operations; and business-modeling methods.
Develop and implement test plans / scenarios to ensure successful project delivery.
Provide support to various business and technology teams as necessary during design, development and delivery to ensure solid, scalable, robust solutions.
Help identify, assess, and mitigate risks associated with each solution/design.
Prepare communication plans and reports for key stakeholders.
Based on business user requirements, prepare Request for Proposals (RFP) for 3rd party vendors and consultants and evaluate potential solutions based on identified criteria.
Coach, mentor, and train staff on business analysis and project management methodology.
Provide project leadership, work direction and feedback.
Motivate work of others outside of direct authority to ensure project milestones and deliverables are met.
Communicate and work with consultants as needed.
Work closely in a global team environment
Assist in creating and developing policies and procedures for business analysis and project management.
Assist with developing the long-term strategic goals and budget planning.
Perform other duties as requested by the department manager.

Other projects as needed.

Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or other related field required

3-5 years Business Analyst experience

Experience executing on-time, on-budget project to completion involving cross functional team

Job Title: Business Analyst I, FIS University Program
Job Description:
Position Type :

Full time

Type Of Hire :

Associate Development Program (Full Time Hire)

Job Description

Are you curious, motivated, and forward-thinking? At FIS, you will have the opportunity to work on some of the most challenging and relevant issues in financial services and technology. Our talented people empower us, and we believe in being part of a team that is open, collaborative, entrepreneurial, passionate and above all, fun.

Join the 2024 FIS University Program!

As a 2024 FIS University Program full-time employee, you will have the opportunity to participate in team projects, community service activities, professional development seminars and work with a team that is invested in your growth, development, and success; including bi-annual performance connects with your manager.

This two-year full-time program has start dates in January, March, June, and September with a dedicated “Learning Week” where you will:

Learn how to work within a corporate environment
Learn about the exciting world of Fintech and the role FIS plays
Hear from FIS leadership about their journey and participate in senior leader networking opportunities
Build a network of your peers from across the organization

This position is for a June 24, 2024 start.

About the team

The Wealth, Retirement & International lines of business are a growth engine within FIS’s Banking Solutions Segment. Specifically, the Business Operations & Enablement team is responsible for strategic planning, process execution, cross-team collaboration, communication, partner management, operational oversight, and business intelligence.

What you will be doing

You will identify and create areas of operational efficiency focus by integrating new processes and models with existing ones and influencing adoption and use across all key leveraged services key stakeholders. Focus is on process analysis and improvement planning and execution with an understanding of business needs and solutions relating to current and future business environments.

Plans, performs and implements process improvement and/or business automation initiatives
Responsible for complex business and operating model analysis, design and adoption
Diagrams and evaluates existing and target state processes and controls
Collaborate within business operations team on numerous initiatives across wide spectrum of strategy, business intelligence, divisional communications, partner management, contract management and leveraged services key stakeholders
Develops metrics that provide data for process measurement, identifying indicators for future improvement opportunities

What you bring

Bachelor’s degree in relevant field of study
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite
Fluent in English; Strong written and verbal communication skills
Adaptability, a drive to learn, and strong problem-solving skills
Ability to work well independently and within a team

Bonus if you have

Banking knowledge and/or experience

What we offer you

Competitive salary and excellent benefits
The chance to work on some of the most challenging, relevant issues in financial services & technology
A broad range of professional education and personal development possibilities – FIS is your final career step!
Time to support charities and give back to your community
A work environment built on collaboration, flexibility, and respect
Student Loan Repayment Program: FIS will PAY OFF participants’ undergraduate loan balance over 10 years of service! Eligibility starts after one year of tenure in the program. The benefit applied to undergraduate student loans for US-based degrees and must be in the employee’s name.

*Current and future sponsorship are not available for this position*
